column2: We re seeking a talent acquisition specialist to help us source, identify, screen, and hire candidates for various roles in the company. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication and organizational skills,     About the role     This role will play a crucial part in supporting our growth and ensuring we continue to attract top-tier talent to drive our success. Provide input to ensure that teams consist of diverse, qualified individuals. Ensure that staffing needs are being met with a long-term strategy in mind.      Experience Required     Minimum 2+ year experience required     Responsibilities:       Identify and engage with potential candidates for technical positions such as software developers, engineers, and IT specialists.     Utilize various recruitment channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks, to source qualified candidates.     Conduct initial screenings and interviews to assess candidates technical skills, cultural fit, and qualifications.     Build and maintain strong relationships with candidates throughout the recruitment process.     Provide a positive candidate experience by ensuring clear communication, feedback, and transparency.     Partner closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and requirements.     Assist in defining job descriptions and specifications for technical roles.     Stay updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitive market intelligence to support effective hiring strategies.     Track and analyze recruitment metrics and KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of talent acquisition efforts.     Provide regular reports to HR and management on recruitment progress.       What were looking for       Strong focus on technical roles in the IT industry.     Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and recruitment software.     Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple recruitment projects simultaneously.     Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.       Bonus points if you have...       Devise and implement sourcing strategies, such as an employer branding initiative, to build pipelines for potential applicants     Create and implement end-to-end hiring processes to ensure a positive experience for candidates     Form close relationships with hiring managers to ensure clear expectations for candidates and interviewers
column11: Interpersonal skills, Talent acquisition, Staffing, Social media, Focus, Market intelligence, HR, Management, Recruitment

column2: Design the selection matrix for choosing the optimum recruitment channel and recruitment source.                     Explores the market best practices in the talent acquisition and implement suitable best practices in the organization.                     Looking at ways to carry out recruitment activities with internal resources and to reduce the costs of the recruitment process.                     Sets the social media communication strategy for different job profiles and functions in the organization.                     Conducts screening and involve in job interviews as deemed fit.                     Monitors the local labour legislation in the regional locations and implements required changes to keep the recruitment process compliant.                     Champions and promote employee referral program internally and to continuously look at the program enhancement.                     Builds quality relationship with the internal customers and external recruitment agencies; to continue to evaluate the external agencies services.                     To uphold high level of customer service with stakeholders and to be a strategic partner.                     Supports the roll out of training for line managers for all recruitment related trainings.                     Reviews employment applications and background check reports                     Serve as brand ambassador at various events, both virtual and physical                     Represent company internally and externally at events with a goal of networking and relationship building with potential candidate communities.                     Counsel the candidate on our values, work culture and remuneration and benefit offerings. Build long-term relationships with past and potential candidates.                     Manage respective candidate pools to ensure qualified candidates remain engaged in current or future opportunities via a robust pipelining.                     Proactively seek market intelligence to gain competitive advantage in attraction, assessment and sourcing methodologies                     Suggest new ideas for improving talent acquisition activities.                     Research talent acquisition trends in the staffing industry.             Qualifications:                         Bachelors / Master s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.                     Proven experience as a Technical Recruiter or similar role, with a focus on recruiting for technical positions in the IT/software industry.                     In-depth understanding of technical roles, skills, and qualifications, including but not limited to software developers, engineers, data scientists, and IT professionals.                     Strong sourcing skills and experience using various recruiting tools and platforms, such as LinkedIn Recruiter, ATS systems, and job boards.                     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders.                     Highly organized with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.                     Results-oriented with a track record of meeting or exceeding recruitment goals and targets.                     Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and best practices in India.                     Experience working in a startup or fast-growing company environment is a plus.

column2: Job Title:  Human Resources Recruiter - Offshore Oil and Gas Location:  Vikhroli West Company Overview: offshore engineering design and energy consultants is a leading engineering, project management, and business advisory firm specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the Oil & Gas, Marine & Naval, and Renewables & Alternate Energy sectors. With a client-centric approach and a commitment to quality and safety, offshore engineering design and energy consultants ensures successful project outcomes while promoting eco-friendly practices and energy-efficient solutions. Job Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Human Resources Recruiter to join our team in the offshore oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the unique challenges and requirements of recruiting for offshore positions. They will be responsible for attracting, sourcing, and hiring talented individuals to meet our organization's staffing needs for offshore platforms and related projects. Responsibilities: 1. Collaborate with offshore operations managers and project teams to identify staffing needs for offshore platforms and related projects.  2. Develop comprehensive recruitment plans and strategies tailored to the specific requirements of offshore positions, including roles such as offshore technicians, engineers, designers, and support staff.  3. Utilize a variety of sourcing methods to attract candidates for offshore positions, including online job boards, industry-specific websites, social media, and referrals.  4. Screen resumes and applications, conduct pre-employment assessments, and evaluate candidates' qualifications for offshore roles.  5. Coordinate and conduct interviews for offshore positions, ensuring alignment with technical requirements, safety regulations, and company culture.  6. Work closely with hiring managers and offshore operations teams to facilitate the interview process, including scheduling interviews, coordinating travel logistics (if applicable), and providing timely feedback to candidates.  7. Conduct reference checks, background screenings, and pre-employment medical evaluations for offshore candidates, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.  8. Collaborate with HR colleagues to onboard new hires for offshore positions, including coordinating orientation programs and ensuring completion of required training and certifications.  9. Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS) and other HR databases, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.  10. Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices related to offshore recruitment and employment. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.  2. Proven work experience as a Recruiter in the oil and gas industry, with a focus on offshore recruitment.  3. Solid understanding of offshore operations, including technical requirements, safety regulations, and industry standards.  4. Experience with sourcing and recruiting for a variety of offshore positions, including technical roles and support staff.  5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and offshore operations teams.  6. Strong organizational and time management abilities, with the capacity to manage multiple recruitment projects simultaneously. Join our offshore team and contribute to building a skilled and diverse workforce that drives success in the challenging environment of offshore oil and gas operations. If you have the expertise and passion for offshore recruitment, we invite you to apply and become part of our dynamic team. Regards, HR Team
column11: End To End Recruitment, Sourcing Profiles, Interview Coordination, Screening, Interview Scheduling, Salary Negotiation, Shortlisting, Job Posting, Interviewing

column2: Experience:  3 to 5 Years Location:  Pune Industry:  Automotive   Job Roles & Responsibilities Talent Acquisition Executive who will be responsible for leadership, campus, and lateral hiring. Also responsible for employer branding, campus engagement initiatives, applicant, tracking and project management. Roles & Responsibilities - Responsible for recruiting positions across levels, functions and specific requirements in businesses including but not limited to leadership and campus hiring - Responsible for manpower planning through demand and supply forecast - Developing new and innovative methods to attract the best talent - Lead employer branding and campus engagement initiatives - Responsible for applicant tracking and project management - Review the recruitment process for the organization and identify areas of improvement to create a  higher impact - Explore different sources of recruitment to optimize recruitment costs Profile - You must have in-depth expertise and understanding of talent acquisition across different positions and specialist roles - You must have a full-time MBA in HR and have experience in hiring across all levels, as well as campus, leadership, and niche roles - You will come with 3-5 years of experience in recruitment majorly in leadership hiring and campus hiring - You should have experience in Manufacturing/Automobile/FMCG industry only

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Executive Talent Acquisition professional to lead our recruitment efforts for executive-level positions. As a Senior Executive Talent Acquisition, you will play a crucial role in attracting and selecting top-tier talent to drive the success and growth of our organization. Your responsibilities will include developing and executing effective talent acquisition strategies, managing the end-to-end executive recruitment process, and collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure the acquisition of high-caliber executives. Responsibilities: Develop and implement comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to attract, identify, and recruit top-level executive candidates. Partner with senior leaders and hiring managers to understand their talent needs and provide guidance and expertise on executive hiring best practices. Proactively source and identify potential executive candidates through various channels, including direct sourcing, networking, referrals, and industry events. Manage the end-to-end executive recruitment process, including candidate screening, interviewing, and assessment, to identify the most qualified individuals. Conduct thorough candidate assessments, including evaluating qualifications, cultural fit, leadership competencies, and potential for success in the organization. Build and maintain a network of executive-level candidates and establish strong relationships with potential candidates for future opportunities. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as HR business partners and hiring managers, to ensure alignment on candidate profiles, recruitment strategies, and hiring decisions. Utilize effective sourcing tools and technologies to streamline and enhance the executive recruitment process. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in executive talent acquisition, and provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Prepare and present regular reports and updates on executive recruitment activities and progress to senior leadership. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree is preferred. Proven experience in executive-level talent acquisition, preferably within a large organization or executive search firm. Strong knowledge of executive recruitment methodologies, assessment tools, and sourcing strategies. Excellent understanding of executive-level job market dynamics and trends. Demonstrated ability to assess and evaluate executive candidates for leadership competencies, cultural fit, and potential for success. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships with senior executives and influence hiring decisions. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple executive searches simultaneously. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS), executive search platforms, and other recruitment tools.
column11: recruitment, shortlisting, ats, head hunting, project management, screening, hiring, management skills, executive search, networking, sourcing, job posting, assessment, talent acquisition, it recruitment, technical recruitment, referrals, applicant tracking system

column2: Job Title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator   Company   Photon Interactive Pvt Ltd  Job Role ?? Talent Acquisition Coordinator  Location ?? Bangalore  Shift Timings ?? 6 pm IST to 3 am IST  Region ?? US  Company Description:   At Photon, we pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence in providing top-tier talent acquisition services. Our dynamic team is dedicated to sourcing and acquiring the best candidates for our clients across various industries. As a leader in talent acquisition, we are continuously seeking innovative ways to enhance our candidate experiences and streamline our recruitment processes.  Job Description:   We are seeking a motivated and organized Talent Acquisition Coordinator with 2 years of experience in US BPO and international BPO voice environments. As a Talent Acquisition Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in the recruitment process by managing candidate interactions, coordinating interviews, and ensuring a seamless experience for all candidates.  Responsibilities:   Post-open positions to job boards and other relevant platforms.  Understand the skill sets required for each position and identify suitable candidates.  Coordinate and schedule interviews with candidates in a fast-paced environment.  Collect and organize interview feedback from hiring managers.  Ensure all candidate feedback is accurately documented for review and reuse.  Provide a positive and professional experience for all candidates throughout the recruitment process.  Maintain complete and accurate records of candidates and recruitment activities in internal systems.  Assist with various recruitment process functions, including document management, onboarding, offer letters, and background check results collection.  Requirements:   Bachelor's degree in any domain  2  years of experience in administration, recruiting, or project management.  Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.  Outstanding organizational skills, with experience in project management being a plus.  Previous experience in HR generalist or talent acquisition roles, including scheduling, logistics, and managing business stakeholders.  Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively within and outside of HR departments.  If you are a motivated individual with a passion for talent acquisition and a desire to excel in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for the Talent Acquisition Coordinator position at Photon. Join our team and be part of our mission to connect top talent with exceptional opportunities.
column11: HR Coordination, HR Administration, US Staffing, Interview Scheduling, Support Hiring

column2: Role- Assistant Manager, Leadership Hiring  Location : Gurgaon (Hybrid) About the job Welcome to the Future of Digital Business Integration This is your invitation to play a part in our global mission to create digital, AI-powered business services for the worlds most innovative brands, backed by our cutting-edge technological platforms and, most importantly, our empathetic human touch. We believe that your talent is the missing piece of our companys puzzle, where you will be encouraged to use it to bring creative projects to life, partnering with individuals that reflect the rich diversity of our planet, under a global roof that provides equitable access to opportunities for everyone.  Because together, we are inspired to be the best. The Opportunity | Assistant Manager [IC role] - Executive Recruitment In this role, you will search, screen, and select place the right candidates for high-level positions that are key to the success of Teleperformance. You will be the starting point that will determine if they are a match, fully qualified, and passionate about the position. Your role in executive recruitment will be very competitive, as you may have to actively interact with candidates who are already in high demand or during contracts with other employers, so negotiation skills will be critical for success. You will help us streamline the recruiting process to ensure that suitable candidates are appointed within the appropriate time frames and provide support to our global talent sourcing teams. You will be the point of contact for the hiring managers, implement the search process, and liaise with the hiring manager regarding the pipeline and candidate suggestions. The role is heavily analytical and requires good project management and time management skills. Furthermore, the candidate must be a strong communicator and be able to negotiate firmly, both with the candidate and with upper management positions. As a Assistant Manager, You Will bring your skills in executive and leadership Talent Acquisition with a focus on Niche Talent Sourcing for global recruitment processes. This will include Head-Hunting, Talent Mapping, and Lead generation. assess your stakeholders??most pressing needs and organizational goals. strategize different ways to build talent pipelines and execute tactical research, referral generation, and sourcing approach or techniques by using a variety of channels and presenting detailed candidate profile summaries at the closing date. most likely be the first interviewer for candidates. Executive Recruiters should be deeply in touch with their hiring managers and their needs, saving them valuable time. bring your proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS). assess job descriptions and additional assessments based on in-take calls with the hiring managers. develop sustainable candidate talent pools & define strategies for healthy pipelines. Participate in compensation negotiations & discussions with candidates and work closely with businesses to determine terms. advise stakeholders with best-recruiting practices and outside-the-box solutions. follow up with hiring managers to obtain up-to-date input on potential hires. Key First-Year Objectives Efficient usage of ATS system, social media & Job Boards. Effective stakeholder experience and engagement. Utilisation of low-cost hiring channels. Presenting a well-rounded Diversity slate to Hiring Managers. What Will You Need to Succeed? BPO industry experience preferred. Bachelor?? degree or MBA. Experience with significant Executive and Leadership placements firms are a plus. Professional networking skills are a must. Experience with HRMS, ATS tools, MS Office, especially MS Excel. Critical thinker and problem-solver. Team player with outstanding time-management skills. Precise and detail-oriented, prepared for an ever-changing, fast-paced environment. Confidentiality and trust when conducting background checks and distributing sensitive information. Persistent and persuasive with top recruits. Interpersonal skills with an interest in conversing with different people from unique backgrounds. Highly organized and thorough. The Skills You Bring Excellent listener with a high level of attention to detail. Critical thinker and problem-solver. Highly organized and thorough. Technical knowledge to use software programs, listing job opportunities, and conducting virtual interviews. Curiosity and a desire to understand multiple fields and industries. Empathy and understanding in navigating life-changing processes. Confident decision-making skills in resolving disputes and reviewing candidates. Flexibility in ever-changing landscapes and job markets. Why Should You Be Excited to Join the Teleperformance Family? We encourage you to live well. To establish the right work-life balance. We want you to focus on your future with our financial benefits plans. We want you to keep learning, with great leadership development options for everyone. We encourage you to be creative and to provide outside-the-box solutions. We care about our citizens of the world with our great give-back programs. We work hard to cultivate a supportive and welcoming workplace for everyone. We encourage a full range of diverse and talented candidates to apply for our positions. We are committed to building an inclusive workplace with our DE&I programs. Our Cloud Campuses open their doors for you to lead from any location on the globe.

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Executive Talent Acquisition professional to lead our recruitment efforts for executive-level positions. As a Senior Executive Talent Acquisition, you will play a crucial role in attracting and selecting top-tier talent to drive the success and growth of our organization. Your responsibilities will include developing and executing effective talent acquisition strategies, managing the end-to-end executive recruitment process, and collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure the acquisition of high-caliber executives. Responsibilities: Develop and implement comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to attract, identify, and recruit top-level executive candidates. Partner with senior leaders and hiring managers to understand their talent needs and provide guidance and expertise on executive hiring best practices. Proactively source and identify potential executive candidates through various channels, including direct sourcing, networking, referrals, and industry events. Manage the end-to-end executive recruitment process, including candidate screening, interviewing, and assessment, to identify the most qualified individuals. Conduct thorough candidate assessments, including evaluating qualifications, cultural fit, leadership competencies, and potential for success in the organization. Build and maintain a network of executive-level candidates and establish strong relationships with potential candidates for future opportunities. Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as HR business partners and hiring managers, to ensure alignment on candidate profiles, recruitment strategies, and hiring decisions. Utilize effective sourcing tools and technologies to streamline and enhance the executive recruitment process. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in executive talent acquisition, and provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Prepare and present regular reports and updates on executive recruitment activities and progress to senior leadership. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree is preferred. Proven experience in executive-level talent acquisition, preferably within a large organization or executive search firm. Strong knowledge of executive recruitment methodologies, assessment tools, and sourcing strategies. Excellent understanding of executive-level job market dynamics and trends. Demonstrated ability to assess and evaluate executive candidates for leadership competencies, cultural fit, and potential for success. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships with senior executives and influence hiring decisions. Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple executive searches simultaneously. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS), executive search platforms, and other recruitment tools.

column2: Job Overview: As a Talent Acquisition (TA) Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the recruitment function through insightful reports, efficient data management, and adept utilization of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other relevant tools. Your responsibilities will encompass detailed analysis, data handling, and familiarity with various software platforms essential for effective talent acquisition processes. Additionally, proficiency in Google Apps Script, Looker Studio, or Power BI would be advantageous, although not mandatory. Key Responsibilities: Reports and Analysis: Generate regular reports on recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and source effectiveness, to aid in strategic decision-making. Conduct in-depth analysis of recruitment data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with stakeholders to develop customized reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights. Data Management: Ensure accuracy and integrity of recruitment data by implementing robust data management practices. Maintain and update candidate databases, ensuring information is current and accessible to relevant stakeholders. Streamline data collection processes to enhance efficiency and facilitate data-driven decision-making. ATS & Other Tools Experience: Utilize ATS functionalities to manage candidate pipelines, track applicant progress, and streamline recruitment workflows. Demonstrate proficiency in navigating and optimizing various recruitment tools and platforms, including but not limited to job boards, resume databases, and assessment tools. Provide training and support to recruiters and hiring managers on ATS usage and best practices. Good to Have: Familiarity with Google Apps Script for automation and customization of recruitment processes. Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker Studio or Power BI to create dynamic and insightful reports. Ability to adapt and learn new technologies and tools quickly to enhance efficiency and effectiveness in talent acquisition operations. Qualifications and Skills: Proven experience in any data analytics role is an added advantage. Detail-oriented approach with a focus on data accuracy and quality. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and generate actionable insights. Any Bachelor's degree. Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. Experience in using ATS platforms and other recruitment software is an added advantage. Good problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards process improvement. Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment. Working Days:  6 Days a week Location:  NxtWave's Head Office Hyderabad Timings : 10:00 AM - 07:00 PM CTC:  Opportunity to earn upto 5.4LPA

column1: Non It Recruitment Consultant/ US process
column2: Company Description VEDAK is an expert network that provides simple, fast, and affordable access to experts through phone calls or short-term consulting assignments. Our mission is to build the largest network of experts in India and overseas, connecting clients with them to make informed decisions for businesses and industries. With over 125k pre-vetted experts, including those with elite education from institutions like IIT and IIM, and an average industry experience of 17+, we deliver high-quality consulting services at market-beating rates. We work with top-tier consulting and private equity clients and ensure seamless expert engagement. Role Description This is a full-time, on-site role for a Non IT recruiter in Bengaluru. As a Non IT recruiter at VEDAK, your responsibilities will include full-life cycle recruiting, Non IT recruitment, hiring, You will play a critical role in identifying and attracting top talent to meet the staffing needs of our clients. Requirements    Positive, ambitious, energetic self-starters with close attention-to-detail  Excellent communication skills with a strong command of English (Email and Calls)  Experience dealing with client servicing, project management, recruitment is a plus. Front end experience is desirable  Emotional intelligence and a penchant for connecting people  2-3 years work experience, preferably in market research/recruitment/advisory with client- facing and/or sales exposure  Self-disciplined and capable of identifying and completing critical tasks independently and with a sense of urgency

column2: Job Title: TA Manager   Location: Hyderabad, India   Department: Recruitment & Talent Acquisition.   Reports To: CHRO   Job Summary:  We are looking for a dedicated and experienced TA Manager to join our team in Hyderabad, India. As a TA Manager, you will be responsible for talent acquisition. This role involves extensive hiring of volume, lateral & international positions.  Job Title:  Talent Acquisition Manager  Location:   HYD  Company:  Square Business Services  About Us:   Square Business Services Pvt Ltd is a leading BPO company in India, providing exceptional customer service and support to our global clients. We're a dynamic and fast-paced organization with a strong commitment to our employees. As an HR Analyst, you'll play a vital role in supporting our talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies.  Responsibilities:   - Develop and implement recruitment strategies to meet the organization's hiring needs.  - Lead, mentor, and manage a team of recruiters and HR professionals.  - Partner with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment plans.  - Source, screen, and interview candidates to assess their qualifications and fit for the organization.  - Manage the entire recruitment process from job posting to offer acceptance.  - Utilize various recruitment channels, including social media, job boards, and networking events, to attract qualified candidates.  - Build and maintain relationships with external recruitment agencies and vendors.  - Analyze recruitment metrics to track the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and make data-driven decisions.  - Stay informed about industry trends and best practices in talent acquisition and recommend improvements to the recruitment process.  Qualifications:    - Bachelors degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field (Master's degree preferred).  - 8+ years of experience in talent acquisition or recruitment, with 8years in a leadership role.  - Proven experience in developing and implementing recruitment strategies.  - Strong understanding of recruitment best practices, including sourcing techniques and candidate assessment methods.  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  - Ability to build and maintain relationships with hiring managers, candidates, and external partners.  - Proficiency in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and other recruitment software.  - Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret recruitment data.  "We are seeking dynamic candidates who thrive in a flexible work environment, ready to adapt to various shift timings and willing to work on weekly offs/holidays as needed. This role is perfect for those who bring a relentless drive to meet hiring targets without compromising on delivery timelines. If you are eager to excel in a fast-paced setting and committed to outstanding results, we encourage you to apply."  Share Your resume on subhavana.m@sqaurebserve.com 9398196719

column2: Roles and Responsibilities:   Be a part of our vibrant pan-Indian network of women professionals  ( some of whom have been with us since about 5 years, some more than 10 years ) ,  which includes Chartered Accountants , MBAs and others. Assist  reputed  CA firms / companies  by recruiting  Chartered Accountants  for them  - all this while offering the convenience of working from home to the extent of your availability.  Undertake the following tasks:   Screening CVs of job applicants ( Chartered Accountants ) received by e-mail and shortlisting candidates;  Interviewing / Coordinating by 'phone /e-mail with the candidates;  Coordinating by 'phone /e-mail with the employer companies that have retained us to schedule interviews and obtaining feedback.  Based on performance, you could move to a role where you supervise the above-mentioned tasks.  Expected Working Hours:   Minimum  4 hours daily, on an average, working from home.  Opportunity to work more than the minimum hours if convenient to you.  You should not be engaged in any other part-time recruitment work or any other full-time employment.  Desired Candidate Profile:   You should have a minimum of about 8 years post qualification experience as a CA;  You should have good communication skills, reasoning ability, and persistence;  You should not be engaged in any other part-time recruitment work or any other full-time employment.  We would expect you to work with us as a partner in the spirit of entrepreneurship rather than that of an employee.  Therefore, ONLY if you would necessarily like to work on a proactive basis with our support you should apply.   Remuneration:  Is an attractive share in fee earned on placements made (no limit) PLUS Incentives of upto Rs. 5,500 per candidate interviewed / selected even if they do not join the client.

Screen these profiles and recommend non-duplicate candidates for further processing, ensuring their relevance and gauging the interest level of each candidate. i.e.  End To End Recruitment  Process from Souring till Onboarding  Remote Flexibility:  Take on a comprehensive, remote role where you helm the operations, guiding your trajectory and tempo. Perks and benefits   Perks We encourage our Team toward #MakeMySalary This is a Success Driven Commission-Based Model and does Not Comprise Any Fixed Salary Structure i.e. NO FIXED SALARY Commission -  30 % Of Our Final Invoice Amount with the Client ( Excl. Of Taxes ) Payment Terms -  15 Days From Receipt of Client Payment (Min 90 Days ) Replacement Terms -  90 Days from the Date of Joining Preferred candidate profile   Key Responsibilities: Oversee end-to-end recruitment processes, including full-time, contract-based positions, sourcing (both direct and indirect), pre-screening, interviewing, reference verification, offer negotiations, and onboarding documentation. A forward-thinking, alert, and receptive mindset. An unyielding drive for success. Professionalism, adaptability, and resilience. What Sets You Apart: Experience in handling multiple client interactions simultaneously. The talent to inspire interest in candidates for our client requirements. column2: Job Title: Bench Sales Recruiter (Night Shift) Location: Noida Sector 61, Rajouri  Job Type: Full-Time, Night Shift Company: Texas Review  Job Description: We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Bench Sales Recruiter to join our team for the night shift. As a Bench Sales Recruiter, you will be responsible for identifying and engaging potential clients to place bench resources (IT consultants) on projects and contracts. This role requires strong communication skills, sales acumen, and a deep understanding of the IT staffing industry. Responsibilities: Identify and target potential clients in the IT industry to generate business opportunities for placing bench resources on projects and contracts. Develop and maintain relationships with key decision-makers, hiring managers, and procurement teams at client organisations to understand their staffing needs and requirements. Proactively reach out to clients through cold calling, email campaigns, networking events, and other sales strategies to promote our bench resources and services. Negotiate contract terms, rates, and agreements with clients, ensuring mutually beneficial outcomes for both parties. Collaborate with account managers and recruiters to identify suitable bench resources for client requirements and facilitate the submission process. Track and manage sales leads, opportunities, and client interactions in the CRM system, ensuring accurate and up-to-date records. Stay updated on market trends, industry developments, and client needs to identify new business opportunities and drive sales growth. Provide regular reports and updates on sales activities, pipeline status, and revenue projections to management. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in bench sales or IT staffing, preferably in a sales or business development role. Strong understanding of the IT industry, including technologies, trends, and market dynamics. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships with clients. Proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth in a competitive sales environment. Ability to work independently and prioritise tasks effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. Proficiency in using CRM systems and sales tools to track leads, opportunities, and sales performance. Flexibility to work night shifts as per the company's business requirements. To apply, please submit your resume to  chelsi.jain@texasreview.in  / 7701855915

column2: About USV Private Limited: USV, a top-15 pharmaceutical company in India, excels in the diabetes and cardio sectors. We have a presence in over 65 countries with our dynamic team of over 7,000 across generations. Our commitment to brand building is evident in our popular products like Glycomet GP, Ecosprin AV, Jalra, Tazloc, Glynase and more. Reports to : Head- Talent Acquisition? Location  : Govandi ( East ), Mumbai (alternate Saturday working/ Candidate should have worked with Promoters directly?) About Talent Acquisition at USV : Talent Acquisition at USV aims to source, attract, recruit, and onboard talented individuals who meet USVs organizational needs and culture. We focus on strategic alignment with USVs business objectives, ensuring a seamless and effective recruitment process.? We are looking for a passionate, creative, collaborative, and solutions-oriented teammate to join our Corporate HR Talent Acquisition team. The candidate should have prior experience in recruitment, with knowledge of screening, interviewing, and hiring practices. Position Summary: The Assistant Manager - TA is an individual contributor role with reporting to Talent Acquisition Head. This position will deliver on the Talent Acquisition strategy for USV, overseeing the entire recruitment process from sourcing to onboarding for Corporate Office. This role requires a strategic thinker, highly networked and an incumbent with a deep understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and talent market trends. Stakeholders - Internal:  CXOs and Business Heads, Function Heads, Line Managers, HRBPs - HO, Plant & Sales External:  Recruitment Agencies and Educational Institutes Key Responsibilities : Responsible for executing the recruitment strategy effectively, with a focus on consistently achieving the manpower targets Partner with hiring managers to determine staffing needs, work, and form relationships with internal management teams to gain better understanding of their hiring needs Manage end to end recruitment processes - actively source CV's and candidates using job portals , databases, social media etc. Understand job specs, Screen candidates resumes and job applications. Conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting andselection tools/methods to filter candidates within schedule Prepare and roll out offers under the guidance of the manager.? Develop and implement recruitment strategies for key/ niche positions Ensure key targets are met like on time delivery, Cost per Hire, Replacement cost etc.? Hands on Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Deep understanding of markets / competition? column2: Manager, Talent Acquisition As the Manager of Talent Acquisition, you will be responsible for leading the recruitment efforts of the organization. You will work closely with department heads and HR to identify staffing needs, develop recruitment strategies, and attract top talent to the company. Key Responsibilities: Strategic Planning: Collaborate with senior management to understand the organization's staffing needs and develop a strategic recruitment plan aligned with business objectives. Analyze workforce trends and industry benchmarks to ensure the recruitment strategies are innovative and effective. Recruitment Process Management: Oversee the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, candidate sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selection. Implement best practices for candidate assessment, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment lifecycle. Utilize various recruitment channels such as job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals to attract diverse candidates. Team Leadership and Development: Lead and mentor a team of recruiters, providing guidance, support, and training to enhance their skills and performance. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment focused on achieving recruitment goals and delivering exceptional results. Employer Branding and Talent Pipeline: Develop and execute employer branding initiatives to enhance the company's reputation as an employer of choice. Build and maintain relationships with educational institutions, professional organizations, and industry networks to cultivate a talent pipeline for current and future staffing needs. Data Analysis and Reporting: Track recruitment metrics and analyze data to evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement. Prepare regular reports and presentations for senior management, highlighting key recruitment metrics, trends, and insights. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field;  MBA ( full time) mandatory. Proven experience in Banking , NBFC  in talent acquisition/recruitment, with a focus on managerial or leadership roles. Strong understanding of recruitment best practices, employment laws, and regulations. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills.

The successful candidate will play a key role in attracting and acquiring top talent for our organization. If you have a proven track record in recruitment, excellent communication skills, and the ability to navigate the hiring process, we invite you to apply. Job Specifications: Talent  Acquisition : Source, screen, and recruit candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks. Build a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs. Interview and Selection : Conduct interviews to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and cultural fit. Coordinate and facilitate the entire interview process, ensuring a positive candidate experience. Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant employment laws. Candidate Engagement : Maintain ongoing communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process. Provide timely feedback and updates to candidates. Employer Branding : Contribute to the development and enhancement of the organization's employer brand. Promote a positive and inclusive candidate experience. Metrics and Reporting : Track recruitment metrics, analyze data, and provide regular reports to management. Use data insights to make recommendations for process improvement. Qualifications: Education : Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field. Experience : 3 to 8 years of proven experience as a Human Resources Recruiter. Experience in full-cycle recruitment, from sourcing to onboarding. Communication Skills : Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with candidates and internal stakeholders. Interviewing Skills : Proficient in behavioral and competency-based interviewing techniques. Ability to assess candidate qualifications and potential cultural fit. Team Collaboration : Ability to work collaboratively with hiring managers and cross-functional teams. You will work closely with hiring managers (client side) to understand their needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Additionally, you will actively contribute to the growth and development of the distributed recruiter network, collaborating with mentors and recruiters to achieve our mission of workforce excellence. Send out daily MIS to recruiters and the management and keep them well informed of the daily happenings. Preferred candidate profile   Experience in full-cycle recruitment, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding Strong knowledge of various recruitment methods and tools Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Proven track record of successfully placing candidates in various industries Ability to build and maintain relationships with hiring managers and candidates Experience in utilising applicant tracking systems is a added advantage Knowledge of employment laws and regulations Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or related field Perks and benefits   6 to 8 Lpa, plus incentives and other perks 3 to 5 Lpa for Junior/ Mid level recruiters

column2: Job Title: Talent Acquisition Executive Location:  Makarba, Ahmedabad. Company Name :  IMS Group About the Role: As a Talent Acquisition Executive, you will play a pivotal role in identifying and attracting top talent to join our organization. You will be responsible for executing the recruitment strategy, sourcing candidates through various channels, and managing the end-to-end recruitment process. Key Responsibilities: Sourcing and Attraction: Utilize various sourcing methods to identify and attract qualified candidates, including job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals. Develop and maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs. Candidate Screening and Evaluation: Review resumes and applications to assess candidate qualifications and fit for the role. Conduct initial phone screenings to evaluate candidate skills, experience, and interest in the position. Interview Coordination: Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and candidates. Prepare interview materials and provide guidance to hiring managers on effective interviewing techniques. Offer Management: Extend job offers to selected candidates and negotiate compensation packages as necessary. Ensure a smooth onboarding process for new hires, coordinating with HR and relevant departments. Candidate Experience: Provide a positive and professional experience for candidates throughout the recruitment process. Act as a brand ambassador, promoting the company's culture and values to prospective candidates. Data Management and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Generate recruitment metrics and reports to track progress and measure the effectiveness of recruitment efforts. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in talent acquisition, preferably in a fast-paced environment. Strong sourcing skills and experience using various recruitment tools and techniques. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and stakeholders. Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management abilities. Knowledge of employment laws and regulations. Benefits: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and career growth. Dynamic and collaborative work environment. How to Apply: Interested share your resume at shivani.koshti@imsplgroup.com

column2: As an Executive - Talent Acquisition, your primary responsibility is to attract, source, and recruit top talent to meet the organization's staffing needs     You will play a critical role in the talent acquisition process, from sourcing candidates to conducting interviews and facilitating the hiring process     Here is a comprehensive job description for an Executive - Talent Acquisition:Recruitment Strategy and Planning:Collaborate with hiring managers and stakeholders to understand staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies     Conduct job analysis and create job descriptions and specifications for open positions     Develop and implement effective sourcing strategies to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates     Stay updated with industry trends, recruitment best practices, and innovative sourcing techniques     Candidate Sourcing and Screening:Source candidates through various channels, including job portals, social media, professional networks, and referrals     Review resumes, assess candidate qualifications, and conduct initial screening to shortlist potential candidates     Conduct phone or video interviews to evaluate candidate suitability and assess their skills, experience, and cultural fit     Maintain candidate databases and applicant tracking systems (ATS) with accurate and up-to-date candidate information     Interviewing and Selection:Coordinate and schedule interviews with candidates, hiring managers, and interview panels     Conduct in-person or virtual interviews, using behavioral and competency-based interviewing techniques     Evaluate candidate performance, provide feedback, and make recommendations to hiring managers     Facilitate candidate assessments, tests, or exercises to evaluate specific skills or competencies, as required     Relationship Management:Build and maintain relationships with candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process     Collaborate with hiring managers and stakeholders to establish effective communication and alignment on candidate profiles and requirements     Develop relationships with external recruitment agencies, universities, and professional organizations to source potential candidates       ?

column2: If you have the passion to work with people and are excited by the thought of collaborating with an international audience, making difference in people's lives around the world, and of course growing your career in the HR Recruitment space, you should interview with us.   JOB TITLE : US Recruiter (Recruiter Level - 1 and Recruiter Level-2) JOB SUMMARY: The key focus for a Recruiter is to execute sourcing strategies and plans with a focus on passive candidates, with the aim of achieving high quality, cost-effective and timely filling of roles. You will work closely with the Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders to recommend and develop a sourcing strategy. Based on your experience, you will recommend enhancements to ensure recruitment strategy effectiveness and will initiate and drive best-practice sourcing strategies Your duties may include, but are not limited to: Responsible for identifying talent that meets specific client requirements.  Build a strong working relationship with Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders. Understanding & analyzing the requirement of the position based on clients specifications. Utilize a variety of recruiting strategies to focus on direct sourced (passive) candidates. Involved in sourcing profiles through job portals, internal databases, and professional networking.  Utilize the internal database to identify potential candidates and post jobs on the portals to increase the pool of candidates.  Call potential candidates in the US and discuss the job openings.  Provide exceptional candidate care and ensure that candidates are effectively pre-screened before. Select and qualify candidates based on skill, cultural, and motivational fit, utilizing behavioral-based Approach and screening criteria. Maintain timely and accurate information on all candidate interactions. Proactively pipeline talent and create pre-qualified candidate talent pools in line with the clients. QUALIFICATION: Experienced : Candidates from the International voice process or US Recruitment background with 6 months - 1 year of experience. The average of 10th, 12th (PUC), and UG marks percentage should be more than 60%. Ability to learn and adapt to working on newer skills and requirements demands. Possess strong written and oral English communication skills. Ability to recruit with a sense of urgency. Availability to work before/after typical office hours as work may necessitate. A strong work ethic and sense of commitment. Ability to work under pressure and target-driven environment. WORK LOCATION:   Allegis Group, Commerce@Mantri, No. 12/1 & 12/2, Shoppers Stop Building, Level 2, Bannerghatta Main Rd, NS Palya, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076. Map link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/4tkVw9Yff6PFz8rVA  (Note:  We are only considering candidates within a 14km radius of our office or those willing to relocate within 14km. We are unable to hire anyone who lives far from our office.   Check the distance before applying)   WORK SCHEDULE:   Night Shift Should be flexible to work on any shift Shift- 1:  5:30 pm/6.30 pm IST to 2:30 am/3.30 am IST  Shift- 2:  8:30 pm/9.30 pm IST to 5:30 am/6.30 am IST Saturday & Sunday fixed off Hybrid ( Mon-Wed: Work from Office; Thurs, Frid: Work from Home) Venue :  A llegis Group, Commerce@Mantri, No. 12/1 & 12/2, Shoppers Stop Building, Second floor, Bannerghatta Main Rd, NS Palya, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076

column2: We at Aliens are looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic Recruiter as part of our Human Resources Team with 0 to 2 years of experience in TA/recruitment profile across industry. The incumbent will be responsible for entire employee life cycle at the organisation including hiring, onboarding and retaining the employees. S/he will be required to run a smooth recruitment process and ensure satisfying closures to all the candidates, both selected and otherwise. The incumbent would work in a high-paced team environment with multiple team members. S/he would be based out of Hyderabad and would report to the respective Deputy Head-Human Resources and Head HR. Job Responsibilities : - Identifying staffing requirements of the organisation, forecasting and planning the hirings - Acquiring potential candidates through various online and offline channels - Screening job applications and conducting preliminary interviews using reliable tools - Scheduling final interviews and ensuring follow up till final joining - Coordinating with the interviewing panel and keeping track of applicant's progress - Ensuring timely offer roll-out by conducting salary negotiations and offer finalisation with selected candidates - Conducting joining formalities and proper documentation of selected candidates - Forming a professional rapport with past applicants and potential candidates to maintain a positive candidate experience - Developing strong pipeline of high-calibre talent for all current and anticipated demands Candidate Profile :  Specifically, the candidate should have : - Excellent academic record with 80% or more in at least one board examination or higher - MBA/PGDM from Top MBA NIRF ranked campus, preferably from IIM, IIT, NIT, Tier 1 MBA institutes. - Knowledge of full life-cycle recruiting components, including effective sourcing, behavioural & motivation-based interviewing, salary trends, negotiation and relationship management - Great interpersonal, communication skills and stakeholder management to facilitate smooth interactions Best Place to Work - Employee Benefits :  Reach new orbits by joining with us : - Learning Opportunity across levels and Professional growth. - Performance Incentives and Promotions. - Relocation Reimbursement and Bus Shuttle. - 3 square meals a day

Organize internal discussion and understand clearly about required profiles.     Review resumes and conduct phone screens, build a potential candidates database.      Conduct steps of recruitment activity with expertise.     Communicate job offers and employment terms with selected candidates.      Collaborate with third-party staffing agencies and portals as needed.     To succeed in the job, our manager needs to:     Ensure that our core policy of Win Win Win is followed in deriving decisions and actions for the mutual winning of our clients, employees and organization.      Be passionate, mindful of organizational needs, contribute to a positive work atmosphere and eager to learn and bring new ideas to solve challenges.     Possess high ethics, professionalism, integrity and able to influence with a positive attitude.     Communicate effectively, be proactive, and solution-oriented.       Required Qualifications:       Bachelors degree     We require candidates with 4 to 5 years of active recruiting experience, proven success in sourcing and hiring individuals for sales, customer service and operations.     Preferred experience in BPO/KPO hiring with talent for hiring tele-callers or tele-marketers.     Excellent verbal and written communication abilities     Strong leadership skills with a dedication to driving and achieving results.       Key Skills:       Talent Sourcing
column11: BPO, Selection process, HR Executive, Telesales, Staffing, Talent acquisition, Database, Talent sourcing, Customer service, Recruitment

column1: Manager- BPO Hiring- Voice- 5-8 years - Pune
column2: LOCATION: Pune Seeking a 5-8 years experienced Senior Manager to lead the recruitment for BPO voice process division. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in talent acquisition within the BPO industry, particularly in voice process hiring. Responsibilities include developing recruitment strategies, leading a team of recruiters. OUR EMPLOYER : A leading global professional services organization, providing a wide range of services and solutions in strategy, digital, consulting and operations. RESPONSIBILITIES Developing and execute recruitment strategies for the BPO voice process division Leading a team of recruiters to source, screen, and select qualified candidates Collaborating with department heads to understand staffing needs  Utilizing various recruitment channels to attract candidates. Monitoring recruitment metrics and analyze data for optimization Liaising with Business stakeholders on hiring requirements & strategies  REQUIREMENTS 1. 5-8 years of recruitment experience in BPO, with a focus on voice processes 2. Bachelor's degree in HR, Business, or related field. Master's preferred. 3. Strategic mindset with the ability to align recruitment strategies with business goals  4. Strong leadership and communication skills. WHAT IS IN STORE FOR YOU? 1. An opportunity to lead and strategize bulk & volume hiring 2. Liaise extensively with senior stakeholders and lead the team  3. Fast Career growth REACH US If you think this role is aligned with your career, kindly write me an email along with your updated CV on  limugha.zhimomi@crescendogroup.in  for a confidential discussion on the role. Disclaimer - Crescendo Global is an ISO 9001:2015 certified Leadership Hiring consulting arm of Crescendo Group with expertise in mid to senior level niche recruitment. We are passionate about empowering job seekers and employers with an engaging memorable job search and leadership hiring experience. Crescendo Global does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. Note - We receive a lot of applications on a daily basis so it becomes a bit difficult for us to get back to each candidate. Please assume that your profile has not been shortlisted in case you don't hear back from us in 1 week. Your patience is highly appreciated. Profile Keywords:  Mass Hiring, Bulk Hiring, BPO Hiring , Non IT Hiring, Volume Hiring, Voice Process Hiring, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition

column1: Hiring HR Recruiter II Permanent Work From Home II BPO Clients Only
column2: Interested Candidates can reach to Mr.Amit Agarwal only through whatsApp @ +91-7817-000-493 (No Direct Calls Please) Key Highlights- No Fresher Please. Candidates must be having at least 06 months recruitment experience with any Consultancy/Staffing Company.  Job Profile will be permanent Work from Home. BPO Hiring experience will be preferred. Own Laptop & Internet connection is mandatory.  Only BPO/BSFI /Insurance Clients. Knowledge of Job Portals is must. About THR Consultants THR Consultants has envisioned being a leader in providing manpower solution to companies across India & on a global platform. To achieve this we continuously improve upon our operations with partner and with experts of the industry. Our aim is to provide everyone on associated with THR Consultants opportunity growth in their personal and professional life. Service Portfolio THR believes that we are an extension of our clients HR team and must perform as a responsible representative of client. We wish to serve the client as "Specialists" for the distinct hiring needs. The focus areas are: Executive Search and Selection. Mass Hiring. Recruitment Process Outsourcing. Head Hunting HR Outsourcing THR Consultants is looking to fill several Full Time Monthly Payout HR Recruiter positions for BPO Client Hiring. The positions are for PAN-India Basis. Key Benefits: Work from Home Portal access if required Fixed/Monthly Payouts* Very low targets Working hours flexibility* Highest Incentive Plan in Industry Job Responsibilities: Must have working experience with any consultancy or staffing company. Candidates must have good Hiring experience for BPO Clients. Proficient in Using Naukri, Shine, Times Jobs and job boards. Good in Handling End-End-requirement. Identify candidates with the right skills to match the requirements. Should understand the requirement in depth to ensure quality sourcing and recruiting. Should ensure to revert/submit profiles with quick turnaround time for timely submittals to meet sharp deadlines of submittals for each requisition. Must have experience on full Life Cycle of Recruiting (screening resumes, interviewing, technical queries & interviews, closing of candidates and responsibilities till joining of candidates). Ability to work as a good team player, interviewing, hiring candidates, Maintaining & building the candidate database. Must be proficient in recruiting techniques like Head Hunting, Calling, --Networking Sites, Referrals, and Internet-Based recruiting Tools. Must have good rate/salary negotiation & closing skills.   Best of Luck!

column2: Artech India is looking for Sr. Executive - Talent Acquisition to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Recruitment Strategy: Collaborate with HR leadership to develop and implement talent acquisition strategies that align with the organization's goals and staffing requirements      Candidate Sourcing: Utilize various sourcing methods, such as job boards, social media, professional networks, and employee referrals, to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates      Candidate Assessment: Review resumes, conduct interviews, and assess candidates to determine their suitability for specific roles      Use various assessment tools and methodologies      Interview Coordination: Schedule and coordinate interviews with hiring managers and candidates, ensuring a positive and efficient interview experience      Employer Branding: Promote the organization as an employer of choice through effective employer branding strategies and initiatives      Offer Negotiation: Participate in salary and offer negotiations, ensuring that offers are competitive and align with the organization's compensation policies      Onboarding: Collaborate with HR and onboarding teams to facilitate a smooth transition for new hires, ensuring they have the necessary information and resources for a successful start      Candidate Experience: Enhance the overall candidate experience by providing timely and constructive feedback and maintaining open communication      Data Analysis: Analyze recruitment data and metrics to assess the effectiveness of talent acquisition efforts and make data-driven improvements      Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies throughout the recruitment process      Vendor Management: Manage relationships with external recruitment agencies or vendors, if applicable      Process Improvement: Continuously review and optimize the recruitment process to increase efficiency and effectiveness

column2: Role & Responsibilities:  As an HR Recruiter at Dallas Ecom Infotech Pvt Ltd, your primary responsibilities would include: - Identifying and attracting top talent for open positions across various departments within the organization. - Managing the end-to-end recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, conducting initial screenings, scheduling interviews, and coordinating with hiring managers. - Developing and implementing effective recruitment strategies and campaigns to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates. - Collaborating with hiring managers to understand job requirements, competencies, and cultural fit for each role. - Maintaining and updating the company's applicant tracking system (ATS) and database with candidate information. - Participating in job fairs, career events, and networking opportunities to promote the company's employer brand. - Ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations throughout the recruitment process. - Monitoring and analyzing recruitment metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize the recruitment process. Preferred Candidate Profile: The ideal candidate for the HR Recruiter role should possess: - A bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. - Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in full-cycle recruitment, preferably in the technology or e-commerce industry. - Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, sourcing strategies, and applicant tracking systems (ATS). - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships with candidates and hiring managers. - Proficiency in using various recruitment tools and platforms, such as LinkedIn, job boards, and social media. - Familiarity with employment laws, regulations, and compliance requirements. - Analytical skills to interpret data and make data-driven decisions. - Certifications in recruitment or human resources (e.g., PHR, SHRM-CP) would be an added advantage. Perks and Benefits: Dallas Ecom Infotech Pvt Ltd offers a comprehensive benefits package to its employees, including: - Competitive salary and performance-based incentives - Professional development opportunities and training programs - Employee assistance program (EAP) for personal and professional support - Opportunities for career growth and advancement within the company Additionally, the company fosters a positive and inclusive work culture, promoting work-life balance and employee well-being.   Thanks and Regards Ms. Karuna HR Director HR Departments Dallas Ecom Infotech Private Limited Office No. 703,7th Floor Ambience Court Phase 2, Vashi Sec 19 ,Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra 400703 Phone No. 8655708954 Karuna.ecomdelivery@gmail.com

column2: primary objective will be to identify, attract, and hire qualified candidates who align with the company's values, culture, and skill requirements      You will be responsible for executing end-to-end recruitment processes, implementing sourcing strategies, and ensuring a positive candidate experience      This role requires strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, effective communication skills, and the ability to collaborate with hiring managers and HR partners        Responsibilities:        Recruitment strategy and planning: Collaborate with hiring managers and HR partners to understand talent needs, define job requirements, and develop comprehensive recruitment strategies      Proactively plan and execute recruitment activities to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates      Sourcing and candidate identification: Utilize various sourcing channels, including job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, and direct sourcing techniques, to identify and engage with potential candidates      Build and maintain a talent pipeline to ensure a steady flow of qualified candidates      Screening and assessment: Review resumes, conduct initial screenings, and assess candidates' qualifications, skills, and fit for the organization      Conduct phone and video interviews to evaluate candidates' suitability for specific roles      Interview coordination and selection: Coordinate and schedule interviews with candidates, hiring managers, and interview panel members      Facilitate the interview process, including panel interviews, technical assessments, and behavioral interviews      Provide feedback and guidance to hiring managers in the candidate selection process      Candidate experience: Ensure a positive and professional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process      Communicate effectively with candidates, providing timely updates, feedback, and support      Address candidate inquiries and concerns promptly      Offer negotiation and onboarding: Collaborate with hiring managers and HR partners to extend job offers to selected candidates      Participate in salary negotiations and provide market insights to ensure competitive offers      Coordinate with HR and other relevant departments to facilitate a smooth onboarding process for new hires      Recruitment metrics and reporting: Track and analyze recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and source effectiveness      Generate regular reports on recruitment activities, key performance indicators (KPIs), and talent acquisition trends      Provide insights and recommendations for process improvement      Employer branding and talent acquisition initiatives: Contribute to employer branding efforts by promoting the company's values, culture, and career opportunities through various channels      Support talent acquisition initiatives, such as campus recruitment, employer branding events, and partnerships with external organizations        Qualifications:        Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field      Proven experience in end-to-end recruitment and talent acquisition, preferably in a corporate environment      Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, sourcing techniques, and selection methods      Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment tools      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders      Strong organizational and time management abilities, with the capacity to handle multiple recruitment assignments simultaneously      Analytical mindset with the ability to leverage data and metrics to drive recruitment strategies and improvements      Familiarity with employment laws, regulations, and diversity and inclusion practices in recruitment      Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion

column2: Job   Title : Executive HR Company   Overview: Wonderla Holidays Ltd is India's largest amusement park chain, operating under the brand name Wonderla. It currently operates three amusement parks situated in Kochi, Bengaluru & Hyderabad under the brand name Wonderla and a resort in Bengaluru under the name Wonderla Resorts. The company commissioned its first amusement park in Kochi in 2000 (earlier known as Veegaland ), the second amusement park in Bengaluru in 2005 and the third one in Hyderabad in 2016. Wonderla is opening parks in Bhubaneswar and Chennai which is currently under construction.  Job   Overview : Responsible for identifying, attracting, and hiring top talent to meet an organization's staffing needs and strategic objectives. This role focuses on developing and implementing recruitment strategies to ensure the organization has the right people with the right skills at the right time.  Responsibilities :   Analyse the manpower plan  and ensure the manpower requirements are met as per the plan. Developing hiring  strategies and procedures to fillup the vacancies within the stipulated        TAT. Sourcing potential candidates through online company portals, recruitment sites, job boards, social platforms,as well as print media, posters, and flyers when required. Engage with candidates        throughout the recruitment process, providing a positive experience and        timely communication. Coordinate and schedule        interviews between candidates and hiring managers Requirements       Strong organizational and time management skills.       Enthusiastic t  build good relationships with people.       Proactive and results-driven approach to   recruitment       Strong analytical skills to interpret recruitment data   and trends       Computer savvy;   proficient in MS Office       Outstanding   communication and negotiation ability       Ability to work   effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

column2: Role & responsibilities    End-to-End Recruitment which includes creating Job Description to Onboarding .    Talent Sourcing: Utilize various channels, including job portals, social media, professional  networks, and referrals, to source potential candidates for open positions.   Candidate Screening: Review resumes and applications, conduct initial screenings, and  shortlist qualified candidates for further evaluation.   Interviewing: Conduct interviews (phone, video, or in-person) with candidates to assess their  skills, experience, and cultural fit.   Candidate Assessment: Administer relevant assessments and tests to evaluate candidates'  suitability for specific roles, when required.   Collaborate with Hiring Managers: Partner with hiring managers to understand their  recruitment needs, provide guidance on the hiring process, and update them on the status of  candidates.   Job Postings: Create engaging and accurate job descriptions, ensuring they are posted on  relevant job boards and platforms.   Employer Branding: Promote the company's employer brand to attract top talent and  maintain a positive candidate experience.   Candidate Experience: Ensure candidates receive timely communication and feedback  throughout the recruitment process, creating a positive impression of the organization.   Negotiating with candidates: Win-win for candidate and Organization.   Recruitment Metrics: Track recruitment metrics, analyze data, and provide regular reports,  identifying areas for improvement.   Induction & Onboarding: Assist in the onboarding process to ensure a seamless transition for  new hires into the organization.   Training & Development:     Collaborate with department heads to assess training needs and identify skill gaps.   Design comprehensive training programs tailored to address specific organizational  requirements.   Develop training materials, resources, and multimedia content to support learning objectives.  Implement training initiatives utilizing various delivery methods, including workshops,  seminars, and online platforms.  Evaluate training effectiveness through feedback mechanisms and performance metrics,  iterating as necessary.  Run complete L&D through LMS (Zoho). column2: We have an opening with  Meril Life Science Pvt. Ltd. Location:   Work From Office : Andheri (E), Mumbai Work Days :  Monday to Saturday. (6 days working) SHOULD HAVE EXPERIENCE IN SALES AND MARKETING HIRING from Medical Devices, Healthcare & Pharma domain. We are looking for a Senior Executive - Talent Acquisition (HR) to join our Human Resources department and oversee full-cycle recruiting for our sales division for global hiring. Talent Acquisition responsibilities include sourcing candidates through various channels, planning interviews and selection procedures. To be successful in this role, a candidate should be able to develop long-term recruiting strategies and nurture trusting relationships with business heads of the sales divisions and other stake holders as well as potential hires. Ultimately, he/she should be able reduce the TAT for recruitment and create strong talent pipelines for our company's current and future hiring needs. Responsibilities Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks). Identify critical, unique / niche positions for building a talent pipeline and anticipates future needs as well. Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening, assessments and in-person interviews Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using Applicant Tracking System Design job descriptions and interview questions that reflect each positions requirements and help interviewers to better. Use metrics to create reports and identify area of improvement. Requirements Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist or similar role in reputed companies. Familiarity with social media, resume databases and professional networks Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods. Should have handled exclusive TA role with large number of recruitment in short span of time. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be down to earth, humble and with common sense. A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations Candidate should have exposure of Pharma and Medical Devices Domain. Interested candidate can share their resume on akshay.revankar@merillife.com
