column2: Job description Job Summary: We are looking for an experienced Recruitment Manager who will be responsible for leading and executing the recruitment strategy for our BPO operations. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the US healthcare/BPO industry, along with expertise in sourcing, screening, and hiring candidates for various roles within the sector. Recruitment Manager will collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand staffing needs, develop effective recruitment plans, and ensure a smooth and efficient hiring process. Key Responsibilities: Develop and implement recruitment strategies tailored to the needs of the sector Partner with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and create job descriptions that attract top talent. Utilize a variety of sourcing methods to attract qualified candidates, including job boards, social media, networking, and industry events. Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and assess candidates to ensure a high caliber of talent is brought into the organization. Build and maintain a strong pipeline of candidates for current and future hiring needs. Coordinate and facilitate the interview process, including scheduling interviews, preparing interviewers, and providing feedback to candidates. Manage the offer process, negotiate salary packages, and ensure a positive candidate experience. Collaborate with HR team members to onboard new hires and ensure a seamless transition into the organization. Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and best practices in recruitment to continuously improve our hiring processes. Track and analyze recruitment metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of recruiting efforts and make data-driven decisions. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience as a Recruitment Manager or similar role, preferably within the US Healthcare sector. Deep understanding of manufacturing processes, roles, and skill requirements. Strong sourcing and networking skills, with the ability to attract passive candidates. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates and hiring managers. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment and deliver results within tight deadlines. Familiarity with applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools. Strategic mindset with the ability to think creatively and problem-solve effectively.

column2: Support the continuous improvement of the staffing function through development and implementation for all staffing programs in an assigned business unit/department, primarily in one geography. With some guidance, conduct recruiting activity for management teams as assigned.     Essential Functions   Work with management in assigned service areas, business units or departments to source, select and hire qualified candidates to fill vacant positions using cost-effective techniques and in accordance with company policies, procedures and processes. Manage applicant flow to ensure availability of qualified candidates and compliance with diversity hiring goals.   Provide guidance and direction to more junior members of the staffing team.   Write job postings to post and advertise positions.   Review applications and conduct interviews to obtain information regarding applicants work history, education, training, job skills, and salary requirements.   Create and coordinate job advertising in various media. Attend job fairs and develop and maintain contacts with colleges, universities, alumni groups, and other organizations to identify potential applicants.   Work with external recruiters and employment agencies to identify and recruit candidates. Utilize Internet online recruiting sources to identify and recruit candidates.       Create partnerships with area employment agencies, advertising agencies, and temporary agencies.   With guidance, provide coaching and counseling to functional business leaders and line management to effectively support staffing goals.   Meet with functional business leaders and executive management, as required, to discuss and establish staffing objectives and ensure they are achieved.   Assist with training line management on recruiting, interviewing, and the selection process as required.   Assist with managing projects related to legislation in the recruitment process within HR and across the business, HR systems, practices, procedures and compliance.   Support a diverse workforce and comply with local and regional hiring guidelines and procedures, particularly for applicant tracking.   Keep abreast of market trends and demands impacting the company s ability to attract competitive candidates; coordinate with the compensation team on salary offer considerations and equity concerns. column2: We are seeking a driven and resourceful Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our dynamic HR team.  In this role, you'll play a pivotal part in shaping our company's success by sourcing, attracting, and hiring top-tier talent across various functions within the real estate sector. You'll have a keen eye for talent, exceptional communication skills, and a passion for building a strong employer brand. Key Responsibilities: Full-Cycle Recruitment: Partner with hiring managers to understand specific role requirements, develop effective job descriptions, and establish strategic sourcing plans. Actively source candidates through diverse channels, including job boards, social media platforms (especially LinkedIn), employee referrals, and targeted networking. Screen resumes, conduct initial phone interviews, and coordinate further interview stages with hiring managers and relevant stakeholders. Prepare and extend job offers, negotiate salaries, and facilitate a smooth onboarding experience for new hires. Maintain detailed and organized records in the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Employer Branding: Collaborate with HR and Marketing to develop a compelling employer brand that highlights the company's unique culture and career opportunities within the real estate space. Attend industry relevant job fairs, career events, and networking sessions to promote open positions and engage with potential candidates. Craft creative job postings and maintain an active presence on career pages and professional social media platforms. Real Estate Industry Expertise: Build a strong understanding of various roles and skill sets required within the real estate industry (e.g., property development, sales & marketing, construction management, investment, etc.). Stay up-to-date on real estate market trends to proactively identify and source specialized talent. Data Tracking and Reporting: Track key recruitment metrics (e.g., time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, candidate source effectiveness) and provide regular reports to the HR team. Identify areas for optimization and recommend strategies to improve recruitment efficiency and overall candidate experience. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 2+ years of proven experience in talent acquisition, preferably within real estate or a similarly competitive industry. Strong proficiency in using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). Excellent sourcing skills, including experience with Boolean search, social media recruiting, and niche job boards. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal). Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple requisitions simultaneously, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Desired Skills Experience with video interviewing tools. Familiarity with HR analytics and data-driven recruitment strategies.

column2: Job Summary:   Are you a fun-loving and passionate individual looking to advance your career in Human Resources (HR)? Do you aspire to grow your skills in a technology-driven company that values your unique competencies and contributions? At SmartDocs, we provide a delightful and flexible work atmosphere where your ideas are recognized and encouraged.? We are deeply committed to our employees, clients, customers, work culture, and especially our technology. We foster an environment that encourages new ideas through collaboration and creativity.? We are seeking highly motivated and talented individuals with 0-3 years of experience to join our HR team. As an HR Associate, you will engage in various HR functions and projects designed to provide you with a broad understanding of our organization and HR principles.? Key Responsibilities:   HR Operations:  Assist in day-to-day HR operations, including employee onboarding, offboarding, record maintenance, and HR documentation.? Recruitment and Talent Acquisition:  Support the recruitment process by sourcing candidates, scheduling interviews, and coordinating with hiring managers. Participate in talent acquisition strategies to attract top talent.? Employee Engagement:  Contribute to employee engagement initiatives and programs aimed at fostering a positive work environment. Organize and participate in company events, team-building activities, and wellness programs.? New Hire Orientation:  Facilitate the orientation process for new employees, ensuring they are well-acquainted with company policies, culture, and their specific roles and responsibilities.? Employee Relations:  Assist in addressing employee queries and concerns. Support the resolution of employee issues in a fair and consistent manner.? Qualifications and Requirements:   Masters degree in human resources, business administration, management, or a related field.? 0-3 years of experience in HR or a related field.? Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.? Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.? Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with diverse groups.? Adaptability and willingness to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.? Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).? Demonstrated interest in HR through academic, extracurricular, or professional activities.? Join us at SmartDocs to ignite your passion and grow your career in Human Resources. Be part of a team that is dedicated to innovation, collaboration, and excellence in everything we do.?

column2: Job Overview: You should be able to support and follow the defined process & methods efficiently and effectively. You should be looking forward to working in the environment of a high-growth startup. You should be looking for a coordinating  role where you also find meaning in your work. Requirements and Skills: Bachelors/Masters degree in Human Resources Management or a related field is preferred. Proficiency in advanced spreadsheet applications is required. Minimum of 4 years of experience as a TA Operations Manager or in a similar executive/managerial role within the Human Resources Department, preferably in a BPO, KPO, MIS, shared services, or large MNC environment. Strong expertise in real-time analysis and generating HR MIS reports, including managing vendor reports and vendor performance. Extensive experience working with HR software and advanced Excel formulas, demonstrating proficiency in data analysis and reporting. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and effectively. Proven ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion and integrity. Deep understanding of HR practices and procedures, with the ability to interpret and apply policies and regulations effectively. Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and collaborate with diverse stakeholders. Demonstrated leadership capabilities, including team management and the ability to navigate multiple stakeholders and priorities. Strong attention to detail and multitasking abilities, with a proactive approach to problem-solving and decision-making. Exceptional organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines effectively. Solution-oriented mindset, with a focus on identifying opportunities for improvement and implementing innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency. Roles and Responsibilities: Lead and oversee the talent acquisition operations function, including requisition management, candidate sourcing, screening, interview coordination, offer management, and onboarding processes. Develop and implement recruitment processes, policies, and procedures to streamline operations, enhance efficiency, and ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations. Partner with HR leadership and hiring managers to understand talent needs, establish recruitment priorities, and align recruitment strategies with organizational goals and objectives. Manage and mentor a team of TA Operations Specialists, providing guidance, support, and performance feedback to ensure team effectiveness and productivity. Utilize data analytics and metrics to track recruitment KPIs, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement initiatives. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including HR teams, hiring managers, external vendors, and candidates, to ensure a seamless and positive recruitment experience for all stakeholders. Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in talent acquisition and recruitment operations, and incorporate relevant innovations and advancements into our processes. Lead initiatives to leverage ChatGPT and AI tools to improve recruitment processes, enhance candidate engagement, and drive operational efficiency. Take ownership of documentation and PPT preparation for talent acquisition processes, ensuring clarity, consistency, and professionalism in all communications. Enhance employer branding efforts by promoting the organization as an employer of choice through recruitment channels, social media, and other branding initiatives. Set up and manage the tools and technologies required for the TA team, including applicant tracking systems (ATS), candidate relationship management (CRM) tools, and other relevant platforms. Working Days:  6 Days a week Location:  NxtWave's Head Office Hyderabad  Timings: 10:00 AM - 07:00 PM

column2: Job description Job Title: Bench Sales Recruiter - (Junior/Senior/Lead) Timings: 06:30 PM IST to 03:30 AM IST Location: Gachibowli, Hyderabad   (Onsite) Required   Experience: 2 Years to 8 Years No. of openings - 10 About Us: GSK Solutions is a leading player in the US IT staffing industry, providing innovative recruitment solutions to clients across diverse sectors. We are dedicated to excellence, integrity, and fostering a collaborative work environment.   Job Description:   We are seeking talented Bench Sales Recruiters at various levels (Junior, Senior, Lead) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidates will have a strong background in bench sales recruitment, excellent communication skills, and a passion for matching the right talent with the right opportunities. Depending on your experience level, you will be responsible for different aspects of the bench sales recruitment process. Responsibilities: Junior Bench Sales Recruiter: Assist in identifying and marketing bench candidates for various IT positions. Conduct initial phone screens and assist with interview scheduling. Maintain and update candidate databases and records. Collaborate with senior recruiters to understand client needs and job requirements. Participate in job fairs and recruitment events as needed. Senior Bench Sales Recruiter: Source, screen, and market bench candidates for various IT positions. Develop and maintain relationships with bench candidates and clients. Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, and networking. Negotiate job offers and facilitate the onboarding process. Mentor and support junior recruiters, providing guidance and training. Lead Bench Sales Recruiter: Lead and manage a team of bench sales recruiters, providing direction and support. Develop and implement effective marketing strategies for bench candidates. Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their staffing needs. Oversee the full recruitment lifecycle, ensuring a high level of candidate and client satisfaction. Analyze recruitment metrics and performance data to optimize processes. Requirements: Junior Bench Sales Recruiter: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Strong communication and organizational skills. Basic understanding of IT roles and technologies. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and familiarity with applicant tracking systems. Eagerness to learn and grow within the recruitment field. Senior Bench Sales Recruiter: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in bench sales recruitment. In-depth knowledge of IT roles and technologies. Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and recruitment software. Lead Bench Sales Recruiter: Bachelor?? degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master?? degree preferred). 5+ years of experience in bench sales recruitment, with at least 2 years in a leadership role. Extensive knowledge of IT roles, technologies, and recruitment best practices. Strong leadership and team management skills. Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving abilities. Why Join Us? Competitive compensation packages. A supportive and collaborative work environment. Opportunities for professional growth and development. Be part of a team dedicated to connecting talented IT professionals with exciting career opportunities. Perks and Benefits : Good Incentives, Medical Insurance, Food Allowance, and Great Career Growth opportunity With Good Learning. contact Details: Interested candidates send your updated CV to haritha@gsksolutions.com and Feel free to contact us for any query 7528877773 Thanks and Regards: S. Haritha Talent Acquisition Specialist GSK Solutions Inc Direct: 7528877773 Email: haritha@gsksolutions.com

column2: The Opportunity | Assistant Manager [IC role] - Executive Recruitment In this role, you will search, screen, and select place the right candidates for high-level positions that are key to the success of Teleperformance. You will be the starting point that will determine if they are a match, fully qualified, and passionate about the position. Your role in executive recruitment will be very competitive, as you may have to actively interact with candidates who are already in high demand or during contracts with other employers, so negotiation skills will be critical for success. You will be the point of contact for the hiring managers, implement the search process, and liaise with the hiring manager regarding the pipeline and candidate suggestions. The role is heavily analytical and requires good project management and time management skills. Furthermore, the candidate must be a strong communicator and be able to negotiate firmly, both with the candidate and with upper management positions. As a Assistant Manager, You Will bring your skills in executive and leadership Talent Acquisition with a focus on Niche Talent Sourcing for global recruitment processes. This will include Head-Hunting, Talent Mapping, and Lead generation. assess your stakeholders most pressing needs and organizational goals. strategize different ways to build talent pipelines and execute tactical research, referral generation, and sourcing approach or techniques by using a variety of channels and presenting detailed candidate profile summaries at the closing date. be the first interviewer for candidates. Executive Recruiters should be deeply in touch with their hiring managers and their needs, saving them valuable time. bring your proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS). assess job descriptions and additional assessments based on in-take calls with the hiring managers. develop sustainable candidate talent pools & define strategies for healthy pipelines. Participate in compensation negotiations & discussions with candidates and work closely with businesses to determine terms. advise stakeholders with best-recruiting practices and outside-the-box solutions. follow up with hiring managers to obtain up-to-date input on potential hires. Key First-Year Objectives Efficient usage of ATS system, social media & Job Boards. Effective stakeholder experience and engagement. Utilization of low-cost hiring channels. Presenting a well-rounded Diversity slate to Hiring Managers. What Will You Need to Succeed? BPO industry experience preferred. Bachelors degree or MBA. Critical thinker and problem-solver. Team player with outstanding time-management skills. Precise and detail-oriented, prepared for an ever-changing, fast-paced environment. Confidentiality and trust when conducting background checks and distributing sensitive information. Please note that all interviews will be conducted in person at our office

column2: JOB   DESCRIPTION: If you have the passion to work with people and are excited by the thought of collaborating with an international audience, making a difference in peoples lives around the world, and of course growing your career in the HR Recruitment space, you should interview with us. JOB   TITLE : Recruiter (US Recruitment) LOCATION : Bangalore, Karnataka JOB   SUMMARY: The key focus for a Recruiter is to execute sourcing strategies and plans with a focus on passive candidates, with the aim of achieving high quality, cost-effective and timely filling of roles. You will work closely with the Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders to recommend and develop a sourcing strategy. Based on your experience, you will recommend enhancements to ensure recruitment strategy effectiveness and will initiate and drive best-practice sourcing strategies Your duties may include, but are not limited to:  Responsible for identifying talent that meets specific client requirements.  Build a strong working relationship with Recruitment Relationship Manager and stakeholders.  Understanding & analyzing the requirement of the position based on clients specifications.  Utilize a variety of recruiting strategies to focus on direct sourced (passive) candidates.  Involved in sourcing profiles through job portals, internal databases, and professional networking. Utilize the internal database to identify potential candidates and post jobs on the portals to increase the pool of candidates.  Call potential candidates in the US and discuss the job openings. Provide exceptional candidate care and ensure that candidates are effectively pre-screened before. Select and qualify candidates based on skill, cultural, and motivational fit, utilizing behavioral-based Approach and screening criteria. Maintain timely and accurate information on all candidate interactions. Proactively pipeline talent and create pre-qualified candidate talent pools in line with the clients. QUALIFICATION:  Bachelors degree. (For recent under-graduates: They should have all the semesters original mark sheets. No active backlogs) 6 months - 1 year of IT Recruitment experience preferred The average of 10th, 12th (PUC), and UG marks percentage should be more than 60%.  Ability to learn and adapt to working on newer skills and requirements demands.  Possess strong written and oral English communication skills. Ability to recruit with a sense of urgency. Availability to work before/after typical office hours as work may necessitate. A strong work ethic and sense of commitment. Ability to work under pressure and target-driven environment.   Notice Period :  Immediate Joiners Work Mode :  Hybrid ( Mon-Wed: WFO ; Thurs, Frid: WFH) WORK   SCHEDULE:   Should   be   flexible   to   work   on   both   shifts based on business requirements     Shift-   1:  5:30 pm/6.30 pm IST to 2:30 am/3.30 am IST   Shift-   2:  8:30 pm/9.30 pm IST to 5:30 am/6.30 am IST  Saturday & Sunday fixed off PERKS   AND   BENEFITS:  Both-way Cab (Free Door Pickup and Drop) - Within a 14 Km radius of the work location.   5 days Working  Medical Insurance. Uncapped Incentives based on each Hire. WORK   LOCATION: Allegis Group, Commerce@Mantri, No. 12/1 & 12/2, Shoppers Stop Building, Level 2, Bannerghatta Main Rd, NS Palya, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076 ( 2nd floor ) Map link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/4tkVw9Yff6PFz8rVA   (Note :  We are only considering candidates within a 14km radius of our office or those willing to relocate within 14km. We are not open to hire anyone who lives far from our office. Check the distance before applying  ) COMPANY   WEBSITE :  www.allegisgroup.com

column2: Job Summary This role is responsible for managing a team of delivery resources to achieve their objectives while ensuring alignment with organizational priorities. The role works with talent management teams to manage training curriculum and improve resources. The role applies advanced subject matter knowledge to scale identified innovative training programs. Responsibilities Manages a team of delivery resources providing an effective environment for people to meet their established objectives. Facilitates structured mentorship and coaching opportunities for program participants. Drives alignment of priorities to the needs of the organization's corporate and/or business function to agreed upon criteria. Works cross functionally with existing talent management teams to improve manager training resources and curriculum. Manages a curriculum portfolio to ensure the team has accurate and up to date training materials and assessments from new hire onboarding through continuing education and role specific accreditation programs. Scales innovative programs that accelerate the speed to competency and progress of delivery resources. Engages with clients and/or subject matter experts to analyze specific business needs, corporate culture, infrastructure, and performance gaps. Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to identify opportunities for process improvement and policy development and recommends changes in alignment with business tactics and strategy. Manages finances for the learning and development delivery team, builds financial forecasts as per requirements of future training programs, and reconciles expenditure with budget allocation. Performs talent management responsibilities including recruitment, performance management, coaching and career development. Do pilot trainings before rolling it out to rest of the markets Education & Experience  Recommended Four-year or Graduate Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. Typically has 7-10 years of job-related experience or 5-7 years of management experience, preferably in training delivery, presentation, facilitation, consulting, or a related field. Knowledge & Skills Agile Methodology Blended Learning Business Strategies Change Management Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) Organizational Architecture Organizational Development Performance Management Stakeholder Management Talent Management Project Management Customer Obsession AI POC New Methods of Training Cross-Org Skills Customer Centricity Prioritization Resilience Team Management Strategic Thinking Impact & Scope Impacts function and leads projects requiring understanding of multiple disciplines or areas of HP. Complexity Uses managerial concepts and company objectives to resolve issues in creative and effective ways. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: Job description: ALIENS GROUP  is a premium real estate player based out of Hyderabad. It is poised to dominate the real estate market with a land bank of 1500+ acres land and to transform the way we live by matching it up with global standards and delivering exceptional quality of living spaces governed by our idea of "intelligent living". Headquartered in Hyderabad, Aliens Group includes companies such as  Aliens Smart City Pvt. Ltd ., and  Aliens Developers Pvt. Ltd ., We have successfully executed multiple projects such as Sweet Home Venus, Fast Track, Aliens Blend, Aliens Valley and Aliens Elite. We at Aliens are looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic HR as part of our Human Resources Team with either no or a maximum of 5 years of experience in TA/recruitment profile across industry. The incumbent will be responsible for entire employee life cycle at the organisation including hiring, on-boarding and retaining the employees. S/he will be required to run a smooth recruitment process and ensure satisfying closures to all the candidates, both selected and otherwise. The incumbent would work in a high-paced team environment with multiple team members. S/he would be based out of Hyderabad. Job Responsibilities: Identifying staffing requirements of the organisation, forecasting and planning the hirings Acquiring potential candidates through various online and offline channels Screening job applications and conducting preliminary interviews using reliable tools Scheduling final interviews and ensuring follow up till final joining Coordinating with the interviewing panel and keeping track of applicant's progress Ensuring timely offer roll-out by conducting salary negotiations and offer finalisation with selected candidates Conducting joining formalities and proper documentation of selected candidates Forming a professional rapport with past applicants and potential candidates to maintain a positive candidate experience Developing a strong pipeline of high-calibre talent for all current and anticipated demands  Specifically, the candidate should have: Excellent academic record with 80% or more in at least one board examination or higher Undergraduate and Post-graduate (if applicable) from NIRF ranked campus Knowledge of full life-cycle recruiting components, including effective sourcing, behavioural & motivation-based interviewing, salary trends, negotiation and relationship management Great interpersonal, communication skills and stakeholder management to facilitate smooth interactions. Benefits: Incentives for each successful on boarding. Three Square meal provided. Bus shuttle available.

column2: ****** HAVING RECRUITMENT EXPERIENCE IN NBFC ORGANAISATION IS PREFERRED***** Job description   We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our Human Resources department and oversee our full-cycle recruiting. Talent Acquisition responsibilities include sourcing candidates through various channels, planning interview and selection procedures and hosting or participating in career events. To be successful in this role, you should be able to develop long-term recruiting strategies and nurture trusting relationships with potential hires. Ultimately, you will create strong talent pipelines for our companys current and future hiring needs. Key Responsibilities : Manage the entire recruitment process from job posting to offer acceptance, including screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and coordinating with hiring managers. Determine selection criteria  Source potential candidates through online channels (e.g. social platforms and professional networks)  Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments and in-person interviews  Assess candidate information, including resumes and contact details, using our Applicant Tracking System  Design job descriptions and interview questions that reflect each positions requirements  Lead employer branding initiatives  Organize and attend job fairs and recruitment events  Forecast quarterly and annual hiring needs by department  Foster long-term relationships with past applicants and potential candidates  Ensure compliance with all HR policies and procedures, including leave management, compensation administration, and performance appraisals. Partner with senior leadership to develop and execute HR strategies that align with business objectives. Job Requirements : Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or related field preferred. Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist or similar role  Familiarity with social media, resume databases and professional networks  Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods  Excellent verbal and written communication skills A keen understanding of the differences between various roles within organizations

column2: Sutherland is an experience-led digital transformation company that can help your business achieve non-linear growth by delivering exceptionally engineered experiences for your (very human) customers and employees. The Team & Role: We are looking for a hands-on Technology & Services Talent Acquisition Partner, with a passion for providing a great experience to candidates and our internal customers, to join our India Recruitment team.   You will be responsible for frontline recruitment process, sources, and channels. In addition, this position will introduce process improvements to the overall frontline recruitment strategy to attract high volume of candidates in compliance with all applicable laws, regulatory and organizational standards. Responsible for end-to-end recruitment. We are a group of hard-working and energetic individuals. If you are looking to build a fulfilling career and are confident you have the skills and experience to help us succeed, we want to work with you! What this job involves:   Ownership of business functions across levels & locations. Manage the full recruitment life cycle i.e. from job post to on-boarding.  Develop innovative and effective sourcing strategies to identify and attract high-quality candidates. Creatively source, engage and evaluate top-tier talent, building diverse pipelines.  Monitor advert responses daily, ensuring suitable candidates are sent to hiring managers as per defined timelines. Ensure candidates are kept up to date through phone calls, emails and automations in the tool Build continuous future talent pipeline for key roles through competition & Industry mapping. Providing insights to hiring managers regarding market conditions and competitor analysis. Promote and drive inclusive focused & diverse recruiting practices and methodologies. column2: As an HR Intern, you will play a vital role in supporting our Human Resources team in recruitment and operations activities. Screen resumes and applications to identify potential candidates. Coordinate interviews and assessments with candidates and hiring managers. Operations Assistance: Aid in maintaining employee records, including personal information, attendance, and performance evaluations. Support in organizing and facilitating HR-related events, such as orientations, trainings, and workshops. Assist in drafting HR-related documents, including offer letters, contracts, and policies. Help in administering employee benefits and assisting employees with inquiries. Handle general HR inquiries and redirect them as necessary. Assist in maintaining and updating HR manuals, policies, and procedures. Prepare regular reports on HR metrics and activities as required. Qualifications: Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Client Relationship Management: - Building and maintaining strong client relationships. - Understanding the client's hiring needs and goals. - Act as the main point of contact between the CornerTree and the client. 2. Candidate Sourcing: - Identifying potential candidates through various channels. - Reviewing resumes, conducting interviews, and assessing candidate qualifications. - excellent sourcing skills from various job boards (naukri, instahyre, linked in, angel, indeed, github etc) and alternative sourcing channels for effective pipeline - building sub vendor capability and manage them with right approach 5. Client Reporting: - Preparing and delivering regular reports to clients on recruitment progress and results. 7. Compliance: - Ensuring that all recruitment activities adhere to legal and ethical standards. 8. Negotiation and Closing: - Negotiating job offers and closing deals with candidates and clients. 9. Market Research: - Staying updated on industry trends, salary benchmarks, and competitor activities. 10. Problem-Solving: - Addressing any issues or challenges related to recruitment or client satisfaction. Overall, the Recruitment Account Lead plays a crucial role in managing client accounts, driving recruitment success, achieving revenue targets on quarterly basis and ensuring client satisfaction. column2: Role & responsibilities     Develop and implement a recruitment and talent strategy to support organizational mission, vision and goals. Engage in manpower planning and forecasting organization-wide; collaborate with Interventions and hiring managers to source talent in advance of open positions. Organize, plan and manage the entire life cycle of recruitment from sourcing candidates to on boarding utilizing the budgeted resources to deliver consistent and timely results. Drive improvements to recruitment policies and processes to ensure a streamlined, effective, and high quality services are delivered, and provide regular recruitment metrics and report on progress. Present thoughtful, meaningful and creative metrics and the interpretation and application of the results in consultation with Senior Manager HR & Head HR. Effective usage of recruitment module of HRMS (ZingHR). Identify targeted advertising opportunities, design all recruitment forms and recruitment materials. Provide support & assistance in interview strategy. Conduct presentations and recruitment trainings to build leadership skill and awareness of legal restrictions in talent acquisition techniques.  Develop strategies to attract talent and increase presence and knowledge of pact as a preferred employer. Ensure recruiters and hiring managers have a clear mutual understanding of staffing policies, practices, processes and priorities. Collaborate and liaise with HR Operations team for operational and strategic initiatives including; new hire processing of documentation, on boarding, Technical Induction, HR Induction etc. Track recruitment metrics and analyze data to evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and identify areas for improvement. Prepare regular reports and dashboards on key recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and quality-of-hire, to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement. Proactively build KEFs talent pipeline and network of potential candidates by identifying, screening interviewing and assessing candidates and by creating a presence at career fairs, on-line and other virtual locations.  Preferred candidate profile   The ideal candidate should possess a minimum of 5-10 years of recruitment experience out of which minimum 3 years experience is in the social/education sector is preferred. Alternatively, the candidate should possess equivalent experience in a leading executive search firm.   Work Skills    Self- starter, proactive in finding solutions and result oriented Strong inter personal, networking and collaboration skills  Effective time management skills with prior success at executing projects in a timely manner and in achieving results on schedule  Effective at developing ideas and strategies during strategic planning meetings Ability to quickly build relationships and influence others without authority  Excellent verbal & written communication skills Strong computer and technology skills, with familiarity in using computer and web based applications (Microsoft Office Applications especially Excel, online portals for MIS)  Perks and benefits   Mediclaim  PF Gratuity

column2: Job description Job Title:   US Staffing BDE/ Business Development Manager About the job Description: The BDE/ Business Development Manager (Hunter) for IT/Non-IT Staffing has the primary responsibility for establishing strategic priorities for the revenue growth through the acquisition of new business. The primary focus will be establishing new customer relationships. This includes establishing near and short-term plans in conjunction with the management team to achieve the company's goals while creating a strong value-based brand with the customer base. The role requires identifying and cultivating relationships with potential clients, conducting market research, developing and executing sales strategies, and negotiating contracts. Responsibilities: BDE/ Business Development Manager (Hunter) will be held accountable for consistently increasing revenue through the acquisition of new business and drive customer relationships into multimillion-dollar engagements. Responsible for quickly building a book of business from your existing contacts for IT/Non-IT Staffing roles. Partner with recruiting teams to ensure delivery to customer requisitions. Maintain consistency and integrity of data. Partner with recruiting to schedule a qualify call in order to gain accurate job descriptions and understand company requirements and cultures so that an accurate match can be made. Research potential new business and current customers. Responsible for ensuring completion of all required sales reports and detailed documentation, including timely entry of data. Focus business development and diversification in keeping with regional and national strategy. Responsible for ensuring the creation and maintenance of business plans utilizing CRM, with targeted new accounts and completely mapped territories and calendars. Key Qualifications: 5+ years experience servicing, supporting, developing, and generating new business and major accounts in IT/Non-IT Staffing. Must have capabilities to generate business from inception and deliver a result usually with a higher value on profit and margin. Recruiting experience - highly preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Extensive Staffing sales experience in a services environment preferred. Strong Technical Staffing experience preferably in IT is highly preferred. Maintain active participation and membership in networking and niche IT organizations. Meet all minimum requirements for weekly appointment activity and revenue growth. Meet with Manager, and inside staff on a regular basis to communicate all customer service priorities and business/sales opportunities. Provide information on customers or prospects for bids and proposals within assigned territory.

column2: The Talent Acquisition Partner is responsible for identifying and attracting qualified talent to Russell Investments in our Mumbai, India office     This role will provide full cycle recruiting for all levels of non-technology positions including go-to-market, fund and investment/data operations, finance, compliance, marketing, administration, and more     The Talent Acquisition Partner will join a growing recruiting team working in-office five days per week               Years of Experience         5+ years experience as a full cycle recruiter.          Qualifications         Bachelor s degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related field.             Special Requirements         Occasional evening work to accommodate connections with hiring managers in other global offices of Russell Investments.             Responsibilities         Proactively identify diverse talent using sourcing strategies and tools including Naukri and LinkedIn.     Manage recruiting searches:      Conduct intake meetings with hiring managers     Source passive candidates     Review resumes and conduct phone screens     Submit candidates to hiring managers with concise screening notes     Liaise with other Human Resources staff including business partners, operations, and compensation     Negotiate offers         Ensure proper input and tracking of searches using the Workday Recruiting system.     Network with recruiting organizations and other industry recruiters.     Investigate ways to reach the best talent in more diverse populations.             Candidate Requirements         Demonstrable experience in creatively sourcing candidates and reviewing direct applicants identifying qualifications quickly.     Excellent sales skills in attracting the best talent and encouraging movement to Russell Investments in Mumbai.     Strong interviewing skills using creative probing questions to seek out qualifications and culture add.     Ability to communicate directly, effectively, and frequently, over the phone, in person, and in writing, with strong follow-up skills.     Ability to work independently and raise issues as necessary.     Generate ideas to improve recruiting processes and explore more creative ways to find the right talent.     Experience with recruiting systems and software - experience with Workday Recruiting a plus.             Core Values           Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication and collaboration skills with all levels of management         Strong organizational skills including the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and meet frequent deadlines,         Demonstrated proactive approach to problem-solving with strong judgment and decision-making capability.         Highly resourceful and collaborative team-player, with the ability to also be independently effective and exude initiative and a sense of urgency.         Exemplifies our customer-focused, action-oriented, results-driven culture.         Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities, has a desire for continuous learning, and proposes solutions.         Ability to act with discretion and maintain complete confidentiality.         Dedicated to the firm s values of non-negotiable integrity, valuing our people, exceeding client expectations, and embracing intellectual curiosity and rigor.

Responsibilities: * Assist Students: Provide guidance and support to students in their job search process, offering advice on resume building, interview preparation, and professional networking. * Recruiter Engagement: Reach out to potential recruiters, establish and maintain relationships with them, and promote our students' profiles for suitable job opportunities. * Interview Coordination: Arrange interviews between students and recruiters, ensuring smooth communication and coordination throughout the process. * Database Maintenance: Create and maintain a comprehensive database of recruiters, job opportunities, and student profiles. Regularly update and organize the information for efficient use by the team. * Feedback Collection: Gather feedback from students after interviews and share valuable insights with them to help improve their interview skills and chances of success. * Collaboration: Collaborate with the training and placement teams to understand the skill set of students and align them with suitable job openings.

Study and understand the recruitment market and clients recruitment requirements.  - Number of vacancies to resource    2. Understand behavioral, skill, competency and compliance requirements of each job to draft job descriptions and to resource candidates.  -Number of JDs drafted    3. Update all communications with candidates and clients on CRM system, and all necessary administrative tasks (e.g. update changes in contact number, address, time away from work, etc.). - 100% updates of the CRM    9. column2: We are seeking a highly experienced and motivated Senior Talent Acquisition Partner to join our dynamic team in Pune      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technology recruitment, with a proven track record of hiring top-tier talent for roles such as Java/      NET Full Stack Engineers, SDETs, DevOps Engineers, and Cloud Engineers      The Senior Talent Acquisition Partner will play a critical role in identifying, attracting, and hiring the best talent in the industry, while also leading talent acquisition initiatives and projects          In this role you will            Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding.      Identify potential candidates using intricate Boolean searches, research, LinkedIn, user groups, referrals, networking, web sourcing, and management of external submissions.      Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and provide guidance on recruitment best practices. Keep hiring managers updated on the progress of the hiring process through regular communication.      Build and maintain a network of potential candidates, fully source their histories, and build recruiting plans to bring top talent onboard.      Call, screen and qualify candidates and assist them through the recruitment process. Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout entire recruitment process.      Manage onsite candidate interview experiences.      Drive offer process - including compensation recommendations, extending offers and closing candidates.      Work with the HR Business Partner(s) and client groups to consult on specifics for the position, leveling/compensation strategy, visa sponsorship, and market trends.      Conduct market mapping and research to stay updated on industry trends and market conditions to effectively target and attract top talent.      Initiate and lead talent acquisition projects, such as market mapping, employer branding, and process improvements.      Promote Cornerstone as an employer of choice by showcasing our culture, values, and opportunities for growth.      Educate/train hiring managers and client management on recruiting processes, use of recruiting software systems, hiring manager responsibilities and current market trends/realities.      Document all recruiting related activity in applicant tracking system.        You ve got what it takes if you have        Experience: Minimum 8+ years of experience in technology recruitment, specifically for roles such as Java/.NET Full Stack Engineers, SDETs, DevOps Engineers, and Cloud Engineers.      Education: Bachelors degree in Engineering or a related field.      Technical Knowledge: Strong understanding of technical roles and the ability to assess candidate qualifications effectively.    Sourcing Skills: Proficiency in using various sourcing tools and techniques to identify and attract top talent.      Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to build rapport with candidates and hiring managers. Proven ability to keep stakeholders informed about hiring progress.      Organizational Skills: Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.    Problem-Solving: Ability to think critically and solve recruitment challenges creatively.      Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead recruitment initiatives and projects.      Team Player: Collaborative attitude with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.        Extra dose of awesome if you have...        Experience recruiting in the IT services or technology consulting industry.      Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software.      Certification in HR or recruitment (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.

column2: Hi, I hope this email finds you well. We are excited to announce an opportunity as a US Recruiter.  Position: Talent Acquisition Specialist Location: Mumbai (Hybrid) Key Responsibilities:  Act as a recruitment subject matter expert in advising People Leaders in the attraction, sourcing, screening, assessment, and selection of talent. Provide coaching and guidance to Hiring Managers throughout the talent acquisition process. Source candidates for high volume, and entry level junior roles, leveraging candidate databases, social media, educational institutions, portals, referrals, etc. Ensure that  job postings are accurate, professional, and attractive to candidates.Market positions tapping into a variety of sources to build a large and diverse qualified candidate pool. Review and screen candidate applications/resumes based on job requirements and in accordance with the Internal Job Posting Program and applicable legislation, ensuring only qualified candidates are presented to the Hiring Manager. Conduct phone interviews with qualified candidates utilizing an established interview guide and applying behaviour based interviewing techniques for all assigned job openings. Update the Global Talent Acquisition Management system as required. Administer online skills assessment to qualified candidates. Monitor and review assessment results. Provide Hiring Managers with a shortlist of qualified candidates to interview in-person, including a brief candidate summary and assessment results. Debrief with Hiring Managers after in-person interviews. Make appropriate hiring recommendations, including compensation recommendations, in conjunction with the Hiring Manager to ensure we are attracting the best talent to the organization. Escalate any concerns with recommendations to the Service Lead. Extend verbal and written job offers leveraging the Global Talent Acquisition Management system and obtain appropriate approvals. Partner with TA Coordinator to ensure new hire paperwork is collected and.medical and background screening is completed on all new hires. Follow-up on progress of background screening. Review results and escalate any red flags to Team Lead as required. Confirm start dates with candidates once checks are completed. Ensure personal adherence with all compliance programs including the Global Business Ethics and Compliance Program, Global Quality policies and procedures, Safety and Environment policies, and HR policies.  All other relevant duties as assigned. If interested Kindly share your update CV at khyati@bvrpc.com.

column2: (Freelance Recruiter Job Overview We are seeking highly skilled and motivated Freelance Recruiters to join our team. Candidate Sourcing:  Utilize various channels such as job boards, social media, and networking events to identify potential candidates. 2. Experience:  Proven experience as a recruiter, either in-house or with a recruitment agency, preferably in a freelance capacity. 2. Location Preference: Candidates from Chennai / Tamil Nadu, Bangalore, Hyderabad / Southern States / Mumbai Skills: 1. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 2. column2: Job Details: Job Title:           Senior Bench Sales Recruiter Duration:           Fulltime Location:           Bangalore (onsite) Roles and Responsibilities :- Marketing and Submitting consultant's profiles to Prime / Tier 1 Vendors. Coordinating with consultants & understanding their skills, informing them about requirements, and submitting as per their comfort. Interacting and Developing Tier 1/Prime vendor network and making sure consultant is placed in minimum turnaround time. Updating about screenings, and interviews with the consultants, and management. Negotiating and taking rate confirmation before submitting the consultant's CV to vendors and follow-up with the vendor for interview feedback Responsible for full-cycle recruiting activity (sourcing, recruiting, hiring) particularly hiring H1B Transfer candidates. Clearly define position requirements and recruiting process. Ensure search requests are clearly defined to include key responsibilities, requirements, reporting structure, compensation, and interview process. Quickly grasp and present solutions to complex recruiting requirements and issues. Escalate and resolve issues in a timely fashion. Develop and maintain strong business relationships with candidates. Required Skills :- Must have excellent written & verbal communication skills Must have strong knowledge of US Staffing and Bench Sales, particularly on H1B Transfers Must have worked mostly with Tier 1/ Prime vendors. Good knowledge of US tax terms like C2C, W2 &1099, Knowledge of visa classification Terms, Rules & Policies H1B, OPT, Stem OPT, H4 EAD Using social networks and research to build an internal database and recruit passive candidates Hands-on working with Job Portals like Dice, Monster, and Indeed and social media Platforms. Note: Looking for candidates who are willing to work from office only. Please share your resumes at mallika.n@ilinksolutions.com

column2: Job Title:   HR Recruiter Job Summary:  The HR Recruiter plays a pivotal role in the recruitment process by providing administrative support to the Talent Acquisition team. This individual assists in the coordination of various recruitment activities, from sourcing candidates to onboarding new hires. The ideal candidate possesses excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment. Skills/Requirements/Roles & Responsibilities Candidate Sourcing:  Utilize various sourcing methods, including job boards, social media, and networking, to attract potential candidates. Resume Screening:  Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates for open positions. Scheduling Interviews:  Coordinate interview schedules between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a smooth and efficient process. Interview Support:  Assist in the coordination of interview logistics, such as booking meeting rooms, preparing interview materials, and communicating with candidates. Candidate Communication:  Maintain regular communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates and feedback as needed. Reference Checks:  Conduct reference checks for selected candidates, verifying employment history and qualifications. Offer Processing:  Assist in the preparation and processing of employment offers, including generating offer letters and coordinating with the relevant stakeholders. Onboarding Support:  Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including paperwork completion, orientation scheduling, and assisting with any logistical needs. Data Management:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS) or other recruitment software. Preferred candidate profile   : Fresher's Only Proficient in MS Office Detail-oriented interviewer Great decision-making skills Fluent in English Salary : 15,000.00 - 18,000.00 + Attractive Incentive's   Work Location : YourPitchh, Jayanagar 9th block, Bangalore - 560069 To schedule the interview contact, +91-8088671484 (HR Mahesh)
column11: HR, Interview Coordination, Sourcing Profiles, HR Coordination, Screening, Interview Scheduling, Joining Formalities, HR Operations, Job Posting, Talent Acquisition

column2: You will develop and execute effective recruitment strategies that will help streamline our mass hiring process and ensure that open positions are filled with top-performers within the proposed deadlines.  You will also work with Hiring Managers to identify position requirements, create job postings, and onboard new employees. We expect you to track recruitment metrics, such as time-to-hire, cost-per-hire, and new higher turnover rate, and put together weekly/monthly reports for Hiring Managers. Responsibilities Assist in the mass hiring process by sourcing, screening and shortlisting, and interviewing candidates Perform background checks, investigate references, and assess candidates competencies to determine whether they are a good fit for the role Handle communications with a wide variety of candidates Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to draw in a large number of qualified candidates Collaborate with our Hiring Managers to determine position requirements for open vacancies  Create and post job ads on various job boards, hiring platforms, and forums Help with the onboarding of new hires. column2: ROLE SUMMARY A Talent Acquisition Manager is tasked with identifying, attracting, and retaining top talent to meet the company's strategic objectives. Talent Acquisition Manager develops and implements a robust talent acquisition strategy that not only addresses immediate hiring needs but also anticipates future demands. Their responsibilities extend beyond mere recruitment; they are involved in crafting the employer brand, enhancing the candidate experience, and fostering a culture that attracts and retains exceptional talent. A Talent Acquisition Manager is a strategic partner to the business, contributing to its success by bringing in the right people at the right time. He/she should have extensive knowledge of the market and the latest recruitment technologies to streamline the hiring process and making it more efficient and effective. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 	Developing Recruitment Strategies: Crafting comprehensive plans to meet the staffing needs of the organization. 	Leading Employment Branding Initiatives: Establishing and promoting the company's reputation as an employer of choice to attract top talent. 	Full-Cycle Recruiting: Overseeing the entire recruitment process from job posting to hiring. 	Sourcing Candidates: Identifying potential candidates through various channels, including social media, professional networks, and job fairs. 	Conducting Interviews: Leading the interview process to evaluate candidates' skills and cultural fit. 	Ensuring Positive Candidate Experience: Creating a smooth and positive experience for all candidates throughout the hiring process. 	Employee Retention and Development: Implementing strategies to retain top talent and aid in their professional growth. 	Supervising Recruiting Personnel: Managing the talent acquisition team and ensuring they have the necessary tools and training. 	Participating in Career Fairs and Events: Representing the company at events to network and attract potential candidates. 	Analyzing Recruitment Metrics: Using data to assess the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and make informed decisions. KEY ROLE DIMENSIONS Geographical Coverage: Zone No. of direct reports: 1-2 KEY SKILLS & BEHAVIOURAL ATTRIBUTES  	Proficiency in HR core principles and practices, including familiarity with applicant tracking systems and recruitment platforms. 	Ability to analyze recruitment metrics to make informed decisions and improve hiring strategies. 	Ability to develop and implement recruitment strategies that align with the company's goals and workforce needs. 	Adept in managing stakeholder expectations and articulate candidate value propositions effectively. 	Proficiency in evaluating candidates to ensure the best fit for the role and the organization. 	Hands-on using social media and job boards effectively for talent sourcing and branding. 	Behavioral Attributes- Driven and in alignment with our Purpose Transforming the life of the common man by improving their financial well-being and anchored by our core value of integrity, collaboration, and excellence.  If interested, kindly revert with your updated resume on mitali@topgearconsultants.com, mentioning the below details. Current Salary - Expected Salary ??Notice period ??Reason for change -

column2: Job Title: Sales Recruiter (On 3rd party payroll) Company: NetApp Location: Bangalore, India Job Description: NetApp is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Sales Recruiter to join our dynamic team in Bangalore. As a Sales Recruiter, you will play a crucial role in identifying, attracting, and hiring top talent for our sales team. Responsibilities: Partner with hiring managers to understand their talent needs and develop effective recruiting strategies. Source, screen, and interview candidates using a variety of sourcing techniques, including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals. Manage the full recruitment lifecycle, from job posting to offer negotiation and onboarding. Build and maintain a strong pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future sales positions. Provide a positive candidate experience by ensuring clear communication and timely feedback throughout the recruitment process. Collaborate with HR and hiring managers to continuously improve recruitment processes and procedures. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in sales recruitment to ensure competitiveness in talent acquisition. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 5-15 years of experience in sales recruitment, preferably in the technology industry. Proven track record of successfully sourcing and hiring sales professionals at all levels. Strong understanding of sales roles and responsibilities, as well as the ability to assess candidates' sales skills and competencies. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with hiring managers and candidates. Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools. Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and business needs. Join NetApp and be part of a collaborative team that is shaping the future of data management. Apply now to?make?an?impact!

column2: Role & responsibilities  :    Team Management and Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage the HR team to ensure high performance. Assign tasks and projects to team members, ensuring efficient use of resources. Provide regular feedback and conduct performance evaluations. Recruitment and Staffing: Oversee the recruitment process, including job postings, interviews, and selection. Develop and implement strategies for attracting top talent. Ensure compliance with legal and organizational hiring standards. Employee Relations: Address and resolve employee conflicts and grievances. Foster a positive working environment and culture. Implement employee engagement and retention initiatives. Training and Development: Identify training needs and create development plans for employees. Organize and conduct training sessions and workshops. Support career development and succession planning. Performance Management: Oversee the performance appraisal process. Ensure objective and fair assessment of employee performance. Develop performance improvement plans when necessary. Policy Development and Implementation: Develop, update, and enforce HR policies and procedures. Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations. Communicate policies to employees and management. Compensation and Benefits: Manage and oversee compensation and benefits programs. Conduct market research to ensure competitive salary and benefits packages. Handle payroll and benefits administration. HR Metrics and Reporting: Track and analyze HR metrics to assess the effectiveness of HR initiatives. Prepare and present reports to senior management. Use data to drive decision-making and improvements in HR practices. Compliance and Risk Management: Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations. Manage workplace safety and health programs. Handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. Strategic Planning: Contribute to the development and execution of HR strategies aligned with business goals. Participate in organizational planning and change management initiatives. Advise senior management on HR best practices and emerging trends. Essential Skills and Qualifications Leadership and Management Skills:  Ability to lead and motivate a team effectively. Communication Skills:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interpersonal Skills:  Ability to build strong relationships with employees and management. Problem-Solving Skills:  Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Organizational Skills:  Excellent organizational and time management skills. Knowledge of HR Laws and Regulations:  In-depth understanding of employment laws and regulations. HR Expertise:  Broad knowledge of HR functions, including recruitment, training, compensation, and benefits. Technology Proficiency:  Familiarity with HR software and systems. Preferred candidate profile   Prefer Male Candidate Perks and benefits

column2: As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you'll be part of a company that values your unique skills and encourages you to contribute to our collective success.            What will you do           Full-cycle Recruitment:    Manage the entire recruitment life cycle from requisition to offer acceptance. Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies       Strategic Sourcing and Screening:    Employ diverse sourcing methods to identify and engage with high-caliber candidates. Conduct meticulous resume reviews and initial screenings to assess fitment       Candidate Relationship Management:    Build and nurture relationships with potential candidates. Ensure a positive and professional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process       Interview Coordination:    Conduct thorough interviews to evaluate candidate skills, experience, and cultural alignment. Facilitate interview panels involving key stakeholders       Negotiation and Offer Process:    Manage salary negotiations and facilitate a seamless offer process. Collaborate closely with HR and hiring managers for a smooth onboarding experience       Talent Pipeline Development:    Proactively build and maintain a network of potential candidates for future roles. Stay informed about industry trends and best practices in recruitment       Data Management:    Harness the power of Lever (ATS) to streamline and optimize the recruitment process. Leverage Levers advanced features to maintain precise candidate records, track progress, and ensure a seamless candidate experience. Use data analytics to refine recruitment strategies and improve overall efficiency           This role is ideal for individuals who:           Have Proven Expertise:    Bring 8-10 years of successful experience in full-cycle recruiting, with a focus on non-tech and niche roles       Navigate Complexity:    Excel in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, juggling multiple priorities and adapting to changing recruitment landscapes       Strive for Innovation:    Thrive in an environment that values creative sourcing strategies, innovative candidate engagement, and a forward-thinking approach to talent acquisition       Excel in Relationship Building:    Possess strong interpersonal skills to build lasting relationships with both internal stakeholders and potential candidates       Champion Candidate Experience:    Are committed to providing a positive and professional experience for candidates throughout the recruitment journey

column2: Job Title:  US Staffing Business Development Manager    About the job Description: The Business Development Manager (Hunter) for IT/Non-IT Staffing has the primary responsibility for establishing strategic priorities for the revenue growth through the acquisition of new business. The primary focus will be establishing new customer relationships. This includes establishing near and short-term plans in conjunction with the management team to achieve the company's goals while creating a strong value-based brand with the customer base. The role requires identifying and cultivating relationships with potential clients, conducting market research, developing and executing sales strategies, and negotiating contracts. Responsibilities: Business Development Manager (Hunter) will be held accountable for consistently increasing revenue through the acquisition of new business and drive customer relationships into multimillion-dollar engagements. Responsible for quickly building a book of business from your existing contacts for IT/Non-IT Staffing roles. Partner with recruiting teams to ensure delivery to customer requisitions. Maintain consistency and integrity of data. Partner with recruiting to schedule a qualify call in order to gain accurate job descriptions and understand company requirements and cultures so that an accurate match can be made. Research potential new business and current customers. Responsible for ensuring completion of all required sales reports and detailed documentation, including timely entry of data. Focus business development and diversification in keeping with regional and national strategy. Responsible for ensuring the creation and maintenance of business plans utilizing CRM, with targeted new accounts and completely mapped territories and calendars. Key Qualifications: 8+ years experience servicing, supporting, developing, and generating new business and major accounts in IT/Non-IT Staffing. Must have capabilities to generate business from inception and deliver a result usually with a higher value on profit and margin. Recruiting experience - highly preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Extensive Staffing sales experience in a services environment preferred. Strong Technical Staffing experience preferably in IT is highly preferred. Maintain active participation and membership in networking and niche IT organizations. Meet all minimum requirements for weekly appointment activity and revenue growth. Meet with Manager, and inside staff on a regular basis to communicate all customer service priorities and business/sales opportunities. Provide information on customers or prospects for bids and proposals within assigned territory.

column2: Job Description: Human Resource Recruiter for Bulk Hiring (IT and Non-IT) Position Title:  Human Resource Recruiter - Bulk Hiring (IT and Non-IT) Location:  Bangalore - Indiranagar and BTM   Department:  Human Resources Reports To:  HR Manager/Director Employment Type:  Full-time About Us:  Rivera Manpower Services is a leading recruitment company known for its innovative solutions and commitment to excellence. We are looking for a dynamic Human Resource Recruiter specialising in bulk hiring to join our team and drive our talent acquisition efforts for both IT and non-IT roles. Job Summary:  The Human Resource Recruiter for Bulk Hiring is responsible for managing high-volume recruitment processes, ensuring that our company attracts, hires, and retains the best employees while growing a strong talent pipeline. This role involves sourcing candidates, coordinating the recruitment process, managing payroll and attendance, and collaborating with department heads to meet hiring needs across various departments. Key Responsibilities: Bulk Recruitment Strategy: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to meet high-volume hiring needs for IT and non-IT positions. Create and manage job postings on various job boards and social media platforms. Utilize innovative sourcing techniques to attract a diverse pool of qualified candidates. Candidate Sourcing and Screening: Source candidates through various channels, including online job portals, social media, employee referrals, and recruitment agencies. Screen resumes and applications to identify potential candidates. Conduct initial phone or video interviews to assess candidate suitability. Interview Coordination: Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers. Assist in conducting interviews and provide feedback to hiring managers. Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Onboarding and Documentation: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including the completion of necessary documentation and orientation. Coordinate with the HR team to ensure smooth integration of new employees into the company. Payroll and Attendance Management: Oversee the accurate and timely processing of payroll for new and existing employees. Manage attendance records, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulations. Address and resolve payroll discrepancies and employee inquiries regarding payroll and attendance. Collaborate with the finance department to ensure seamless payroll operations. Data Management and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate information in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Generate regular reports on recruitment metrics, including time-to-hire, cost-per-hire, and candidate source effectiveness. Analyze recruitment data to identify areas for improvement and optimize the hiring process Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with HR team members and department heads to understand hiring needs and priorities. Provide regular updates on recruitment progress and challenges to stakeholders. Build and maintain strong relationships with candidates, ensuring timely and professional communication. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Strong understanding of various recruitment channels and sourcing techniques. Experience in payroll and attendance management. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and HR software. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. Strong organisational and time-management skills. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in a high-growth or technology-driven company. Certification in HR or Recruitment (e.g., PHR, SHRM-CP, or similar). Familiarity with labor laws and regulations. Benefits: Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Opportunities for professional development and career growth. Employee wellness programs and activities. How to Apply:  Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter to  rivera.urvashi@gmail.com  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Rivera Manpower Services is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
