column2: Role & responsibilities   Talent Acquisition:  Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract qualified clinicians. Candidate Sourcing:  Use various sourcing methods such as job portals, social media, professional networks, and university partnerships to identify and attract top talent. Screening and Interviewing:  Conduct initial screenings, interviews, and assessments to ensure candidates meet hospital standards and job requirements. Offer Management:  Coordinate job offers, negotiate terms, and manage the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the hospital. Employer Branding:  Promote the hospital's brand to potential candidates, emphasizing its culture, benefits, and career growth opportunities. Collaboration:  Work closely with department heads, medical directors, and other stakeholders to understand their doctor staffing needs and ensure alignment with recruitment strategies. Compliance and Documentation:  Ensure all recruitment activities comply with hospital policies, legal requirements, and industry standards. Maintain accurate records and documentation of the hiring process. Relationship Management:  Build and maintain relationships with educational institutions, professional organizations, and industry networks to ensure a consistent talent pipeline. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. A background in healthcare or medical sciences is a plus. A minimum of 4-6 years of experience in healthcare recruitment or human resources, with a focus on hiring clinicians. Familiarity with healthcare industry standards, clinician roles, and medical terminology. Knowledge of hospital accreditation and compliance requirements is preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clinicians and hospital staff. Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships and manage candidate and stakeholder expectations. Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize effectively, and maintain high attention to detail.

column2: The Search Consultant is responsible for Service Excellence throughout the recruitment cycle. They act as a brand ambassador for the client, focused on delivering exceptional talent while providing proactive and timely communication on the status of the search. They serve as subject matter expert in talent acquisition and provide consultative direction and industry expertise to hiring leader. Should have prior experience in Hiring for Wealth/Investment Industry for retail wealth managers or HNI wealth managers.  Responsibilities: Finding Candidates: - Lead a detailed job scope meeting with the hiring leader to determine position specifications, providing relevant market data and recommendations on possible approaches to the search or candidate requirements. Review of candidates who have applied via the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Evaluate candidate qualifications against position requirements and determine who to move forward in the recruitment process. Develop and manage recruitment marketing plans or sourcing plans to determine the most appropriate candidate sources that align to the search requirements. Source candidates via resume databases, search engine and networking sites using Boolean search language. Solicit and pursue referrals from business networks and/or internal referrals. Utilize Cielos proprietary software for mobile and email campaigning to talent communities. Engaging Candidates: - Use an appropriate mix of media to connect with talent communities (phone, email, social media, etc.). Articulate value proposition to candidates who are interested in the job opportunity. Prepare candidates for interviews, coaching them on logistical information, interview schedule, appropriate attire and overall expectations. Ensure candidates are provided with timely updates concerning the status of their applications and interviews. Assessing Candidates: - Draft and utilize phone interview templates appropriate to the job description. Use independent judgement to compare candidate phone interview notes and skills assessments with position requirements to determine if the candidate is a match for the role or a potential match for other open positions. Issue skills testing as needed and evaluate results (if process dictates). Review background and reference information (if process dictates). Influencing the Hire: - Keep candidates engaged throughout process, ensuring consistent communication on the status of the search. Partner with hiring leader to determine offer details, using market data and compensation guidelines to support recommendations. Articulate a job offer to candidate and drive for candidate acceptance, anticipating and negotiating counter-offers as appropriate. Service Excellence: - Strict adherence to all regulations (OFCCP and all other compliance standards set forth). Work to deliver a strong candidate slate, continuously building talent pipelines to ensure there are multiple qualified candidates in play at all times. Provide accurate and regular reporting of recruiting activities to the hiring leader and Cielo leadership to depict both metrics and efforts. Identify perceived difficulties with searches and research and recommend solutions to both internal and external stakeholders. Proactively and regularly communicate the status of each search to the hiring leader, providing a consultative approach with recommendations on how to move forward. Education: High school diploma required. Bachelors degree in business, management, human resources or related field is strongly preferred. Experience: Minimum of 7 or more years recruiting experience with demonstrated successes in a corporate, RPO or agency setting. Experience using recruitment technologies such as Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and social media tools. Experience in hiring for wealth / investment industry Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Proficient in Boolean search techniques for sourcing. Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of common Human Resources principles, practices and metrics related to talent acquisition.

Candidate Sourcing and Screening:  Identify potential candidates through industry research, networking events, and referrals.  Conduct initial screenings and interviews to assess candidate suitability.  Maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for future needs. Candidate Experience:  Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.  Communicate effectively with candidates, providing timely feedback and updates. Compliance and Reporting:  Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements related to recruitment.  Maintain accurate records and reports on recruitment activities and outcomes. Team Collaboration and Leadership:  Work collaboratively with other investment professionals and departments.  Mentor and guide junior analysts and investment team members. column2: NIDO Automation is looking for Recruitment Specialist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Recruitment Specialist, your role revolves around identifying, attracting, and selecting qualified candidates to fill job positions within an organization      You work closely with hiring managers and HR teams to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies      Here are some key skills and responsibilities of a Recruitment Specialist:Talent sourcing: You utilize various channels to source potential candidates, including job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, and employee referrals      You may also engage in proactive search methods like headhunting and attending industry events      Candidate screening and assessment: You review resumes, cover letters, and application materials to shortlist candidates      You conduct initial screenings, interviews, and assessments to evaluate their qualifications, skills, and cultural fit for the organization      Recruitment strategy development: You collaborate with hiring managers and HR teams to develop comprehensive recruitment strategies that align with the organization's goals and attract top talent      This includes determining job requirements, creating job descriptions, and establishing effective interview processes      Candidate relationship management: You build and maintain relationships with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing timely updates, answering their questions, and ensuring a positive candidate experience      You may also manage communication with external recruitment agencies or headhunters      Employer branding and marketing: You contribute to promoting the organization's employer brand by crafting compelling job postings, highlighting key selling points, and showcasing the company's culture, values, and benefits      This helps attract and retain high-quality candidates

Source candidates for high volume, and entry level junior roles, leveraging candidate databases, social media, educational institutions, portals, referrals, etc.  Review and screen candidate applications/resumes based on job requirements and in accordance with the Internal Job Posting Program and applicable legislation, ensuring only qualified candidates are presented to the Hiring Manager. Ensure the staffing needs of the company are being met, with a long-term talent strategy in mind Devise and implement sourcing strategies to build pipelines of potential applicants, such as employer branding initiatives. Job Description: NetApp is seeking a talented and experienced Talent Acquisition Sourcer to join our dynamic team on  3rd party contract for the duration of 6 months . As a Sourcer, you will play a crucial role in identifying and engaging top-tier talent to meet our organization's evolving needs. Key Responsibilities: Partner closely with recruiters and hiring managers to understand talent needs and develop effective sourcing strategies. Utilize various sourcing techniques, including Boolean searches, social media recruiting, networking, and referrals, to identify passive candidates. Conduct initial screenings to assess candidate qualifications, interest, and fit for open positions. Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs. Stay abreast of industry trends, market intelligence, and best practices in talent acquisition. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 5-10 years of experience in talent acquisition, with a focus on sourcing for technical roles as well as non technical roles including Sales ops, Customer support, IT, Finance etc. Proven track record of success in identifying and engaging passive candidates. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. column2: Job description Position Overview: We are looking for a skilled and experienced HR Executive to join our dynamic team. As an HR Executive, you will play a critical role in ensuring the effective management of our human resources and creating a positive work environment. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the recruitment and on boarding process, managing employee relations, implementing HR policies and procedures, and supporting the professional development and well-being of our employees. Responsibilities: Recruitment and Onboarding: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract and hire top talent. Collaborate with hiring managers to define job requirements, create job descriptions, KRAs , KPIs and conduct interviews. Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and making job offers. Coordinate new employee on boarding and orientation programs to ensure a smooth transition into the organisation. Employee Relations: Promote positive employee relations and foster a culture of open communication and trust. Address employee concerns, grievances, and disciplinary issues in a timely and fair manner. Ensure compliance with labour laws and regulations, including maintaining employee records and documentation. Implement and enforce company policies, procedures, and code of conduct. Performance Management: Develop and implement performance management processes to drive employee engagement and productivity. Provide guidance to managers on performance evaluations, goal setting, and performance improvement plans. Support the development and implementation of employee development and career progression programs. Compensation and Benefits: Administer compensation and benefits programs, including salary reviews, bonus plans, and employee benefits. Conduct market research to ensure competitive compensation and benefits packages. Training and Development: Identify training needs and develop training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge. Coordinate employee training sessions, workshops, and seminars. Support employee career development through coaching, mentoring. Employee Engagement and Well-being: Develop and implement employee engagement initiatives, including employee recognition programs, team-building activities, and employee surveys. Promote employee well-being and work-life balance initiatives. Monitor employee satisfaction levels and implement action plans to address any areas of concern. Qualifications: Master's degree in human resources field or any other HR certification is a plus. Proven experience as an HR Manager specialising in 360 degree vertical. Strong knowledge of HR practices, employment laws, and regulations. Experience in full-cycle recruitment, including sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding, ect. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with professionalism and integrity. Strong organisational and time management skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. If you are a dedicated and experienced HR professional with a passion for fostering a positive work culture and developing talented teams, we invite you to apply for the position of HR Manager. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our organization.

column2: The Semi-Conductor Recruiter is responsible for Service Excellence throughout the recruitment cycle. They act as a brand ambassador for the client, focused on delivering exceptional talent while providing proactive and timely communication on the status of the search. They serve as subject matter expert in talent acquisition and provide consultative direction and industry expertise to hiring leader. ? ? Responsibilities:   Finding Candidates:??- Lead a detailed job scope meeting with the hiring leader to determine position specifications, providing relevant market data and recommendations on possible approaches to the search or candidate requirements. Review of candidates who have applied via the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Evaluate candidate qualifications against position requirements and determine who to move forward in the recruitment process. Develop and manage recruitment marketing plans or sourcing plans to determine the most appropriate candidate sources that align to the search requirements. Source candidates via resume databases, search engine and networking sites using Boolean search language. Solicit and pursue referrals from business networks and/or internal referrals. Utilize Cielos proprietary software for mobile and email campaigning to talent communities. Engaging Candidates: - Use an appropriate mix of media to connect with talent communities (phone, email, social media, etc.). Articulate value proposition to candidates who are interested in the job opportunity. Prepare candidates for interviews, coaching them on logistical information, interview schedule, appropriate attire and overall expectations. Ensure candidates are provided with timely updates concerning the status of their applications and interviews. Assessing Candidates: - Draft and utilize phone interview templates appropriate to the job description. Use independent judgement to compare candidate phone interview notes and skills assessments with position requirements to determine if the candidate is a match for the role or a potential match for other open positions. Issue skills testing as needed and evaluate results (if process dictates). Review background and reference information (if process dictates). Influencing the Hire: - Keep candidates engaged throughout process, ensuring consistent communication on the status of the search. Partner with hiring leader to determine offer details, using market data and compensation guidelines to support recommendations. Articulate a job offer to candidate and drive for candidate acceptance, anticipating and negotiating counter-offers as appropriate. Service Excellence: - Strict adherence to all regulations (OFCCP and all other compliance standards set forth). Work to deliver a strong candidate slate, continuously building talent pipelines to ensure there are multiple qualified candidates in play at all times. Provide accurate and regular reporting of recruiting activities to the hiring leader and Cielo leadership to depict both metrics and efforts. Identify perceived difficulties with searches and research and recommend solutions to both internal and external stakeholders. Proactively and regularly communicate the status of each search to the hiring leader, providing a consultative approach with recommendations on how to move forward.? Education: High school diploma required. Bachelors degree in business, management, human resources or related field is strongly preferred.? Experience: Minimum of 3 or more years recruiting experience with demonstrated successes in a corporate, RPO or agency setting. Experience using recruitment technologies such as Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and social media tools. Semiconductor experience is a must have. Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Proficient in Boolean search techniques for sourcing. Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of common Human Resources principles, practices and metrics related to talent acquisition. ? ??

column2: As an HR Recruiter, you will be responsible for attracting, sourcing, and hiring talented candidates to meet the organization's staffing needs. Your role will involve working closely with hiring managers to understand their requirements, sourcing candidates through various channels, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and managing the hiring process from start to finish. Additionally, you will play a key role in promoting the company's employer brand and ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.  Role & responsibilities:   Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop job descriptions and specifications. Utilize various recruitment methods and channels to source candidates, including job boards, social media, networking, and referrals. Review resumes and applications, and screen candidates to assess their qualifications and fit for the role. Conduct initial phone screens and interviews to evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit. Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and other team members involved in the hiring process. Manage communication with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing updates and feedback as needed. Conduct reference checks and background screenings for selected candidates. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines. Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruitment software. Knowledge of employment laws and regulations, particularly those related to hiring practices and equal employment opportunity. column2: Job Summary: You are responsible for sourcing, attracting, interviewing, hiring and onboarding employees, all while factoring in the long-term goals of an organization. Your role would demand using  various sourcing techniques to identify potential candidates . You will  use structured interviews  to gather consistent information. You will  schedule and coordinate for the interviews  with the hiring managers &  roll out the offers  to the shortlisted candidates. You will be involved in the  onboarding process of all new joiners . Throughout the day, your primary focus remains on ensuring   we hire the best candidates in the most efficient way. Work closely with stakeholders to understand the role and specific requirements for someone to succeed in the role. Source qualified candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, employee referrals etc. Build & maintain a robust pipeline of potential candidates to meet organisations ongoing recruitment needs. Schedule and coordinate interviews with respective functions. Document all feedback. Maintain a positive experience for the candidate all through the hiring process and ensure feedback shared at all stages and loops closed. Negotiate & extend offers to shortlisted candidates.  Manage the field audition process for all sales positions. Manage onboarding processes for new joiners, ensuring efficient hiring and seamless integration into the team. Track and analyze recruitment metrics. Handle salary administration for newly hired sales personnel, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in payroll processing. Required Competencies You are  flexible  to  adapt to evolving recruitment trends and techniques  to ensure the organization remains competitive in talent acquisition. You should have an  eye for details & execute recruitment tasks with precision  to ensure a seamless and efficient hiring process. You will  analyze the recruitment data  to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in the hiring process. You will  communicate effectively with candidates , colleagues, and external partners to achieve recruitment objectives. You will  collaborate with both internal & external stakeholders  to establish broad and effective networks and leverage these connections to identify and attract talent. Work Experience & Qualifications Graduate or Post graduate in human resources with minimum 3+ years of experience,  Experience in similar industry would be an added advantage Good understanding of end to end recruitment process Excellent verbal & non verbal communications skills

column2: Job Description We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Head of HR Operations to lead and enhance our human resources functions. Roles and Responsibility: Lead the development and execution of targeted headhunting and mapping strategies to identify high-Caliber candidates for leadership roles. Required Skills: Strong knowledge of recruitment processes and best practices. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Strong organizational and time management skills. Qualifications: Masters degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. 10+ years of experience in talent acquisition, with at least 5 years in a leadership role. Proven experience in developing and executing successful talent acquisition strategies. Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices and tools. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Ability to use data and metrics to drive decision-making.

column2: What is Contentstack? Contentstack the leading Composable Digital Experience Platform (DXP) provider empowers marketers and developers to deliver composable digital experiences at the speed of their imagination. Companies such as ASICS, Chase, Steve Madden, Holiday Inn, Icelandair, Mattel, Mitsubishi, Riot Games, and Shell trust Contentstack to power their most critical content experiences with uncompromising scale and dependability. Known for its  Care Without Compromise  program, Contentstack has achieved the industrys highest customer satisfaction rating. Contentstack is also a founding member of the MACH Alliance, advocating for best-of-breed composable technology that is Microservices-based, API-first, Cloud-native SaaS, and Headless. Learn more at  . Who Are We? At Contentstack we are more than colleagues, we are a tribe. Our vision is to pursue equity among our communities, employees, partners, and customers. We are global-diverse yet close; distributed yet connected. We are dreamers and dreammakers who challenge the status quo. We do the right thing, even when no one is watching. We are curious trendspotters and brave trendsetters. Our mission is to make Contentstack indispensable for organizations to tell their stories and to connect with the people they care about through inspiring, modern experiences. We care deeply about our customers and the communities we serve. #OneTeamOneDream. Chalo, lets go! What Are We Looking For? Contentstack is looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist (Contract).  Roles & Responsibilities: Drive building high-volume pipeline creation for our Product and Engineering teams Own the front-end recruiting process by identifying passive candidates, conducting market research, and setting high volume pipeline requirements Champion a positive candidate experience, ensuring each candidate feels positive in their interactions with us Collaboratively work with our hiring teams to understand our roles and improve our sourcing strategies Mandatory Skills. 2-7 years of full-cycle sourcing experience Deep understanding of software engineering recruitment (SaaS exp highly preferred) Experience using and adapting extensive sourcing strategies to meet the needs of complex recruitment activities Expertise in ATS Experience in the fast-paced, start up environment Vast knowledge of recruitment tools like LinkedIn Recruiter, etc Experience driving recruitment processes that focus on providing excellent candidate experience Experience in culture or values based interviewing style What Are You Good At? Sourcing, sourcing, sourcing - you can find any niche individual and have a track record of activating passive candidates Communication - you strive to be concise so your audience is on the same page as you Use data to drive outcomes - gather and share market information and trends with the Talent Acquisition team and business stakeholders, allowing your group to make more informed decisions Actively identify and contribute to Talent Acquisition practices and processes, ensuring those activities align to the priorities of the business Coach and guide Hiring Managers in your group to make well considered, diligent hiring decisions, ensuring alignment with hiring best practices Provide proactive mentoring and coaching to members of the Talent Acquisition team by helping through specific problems and recommending new practices or processes What Really Gets Us Excited About You? Experience in working with product based start-up companies Knowledge of working with SAAS products Work on cutting edge technologies with one of the fastest growing start-ups in the world Key Challenges: R&D, Team Building, setting up a fast paced Tech Culture Position Type - 1 Year contract

column2: Senior Technical Recruiter Location:  Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India Department:  Human Resources / Talent Acquisition Type:  Full-Time About Anubavam:   Anubavam is a leader in technology solutions, focusing on delivering innovative and scalable product engineering solutions. Our flagship product, Creatrix Campus, is revolutionizing the educational technology space with its comprehensive ERP solutions designed for higher education institutions. Our dedication to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction is what sets us apart in the tech industry. Position Overview: Anubavam is seeking an experienced Senior Technical Recruiter to join our HR team. This role requires a strategic thinker with a deep understanding of the technology landscape, particularly in product engineering environments. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in sourcing, engaging, and hiring talent for technology-driven product companies. Responsibilities: Lead the recruitment strategy for technical roles, focusing on attracting talent with experience in product development, web, mobile, ERP, CRM and artificial intelligence. Conduct comprehensive technical interviews to assess candidates' skills, experience, and suitability for roles contributing to the development and enhancement of Creatrix Campus and other projects. Collaborate with department heads to understand specific recruitment needs, ensuring a perfect alignment between candidate profiles and technical requirements. Employ diverse sourcing methods, with a strong emphasis on identifying candidates with prior experience in product companies, to build a rich talent pipeline. Oversee the recruitment process from start to finish, including candidate communication, interview coordination, and offer negotiations, ensuring a seamless and efficient hiring cycle. Stay updated on industry trends and advancements to maintain competitiveness and attract the best talent in the market. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. A technical background is highly advantageous. At least 5 years of experience in technical recruitment, with a preference for candidates who have successfully recruited for product-based companies. Comprehensive understanding of technical roles and skills, particularly in software development and ERP solutions. Exceptional ability to screen and interview candidates, with a keen eye for technical expertise and cultural fit. Demonstrated success in utilizing social media, professional networks, and other innovative sourcing strategies. Strong negotiation and communication skills, capable of fostering meaningful relationships with both candidates and internal stakeholders. Ability to manage multiple recruitment projects in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Why Join Anubavam.com? Joining Anubavam means becoming part of a forward-thinking company that is committed to innovation. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and a workplace culture that values creativity, diversity, and personal growth. This is an outstanding opportunity to contribute to the success of Creatrix Campus and other pioneering projects.

column2: Role Overview:  We are seeking a seasoned HR Management Specialist with a strong background in Human Resources and Industrial Relations. The ideal candidate will have 7-12 years of progressive experience in HR roles, particularly in leading teams and improving hiring processes. As an HR Management Specialist, you will be responsible for overseeing the hiring team, streamlining recruitment processes, and ensuring the organization's HR strategies align with its business objectives. Key Responsibilities: Lead Hiring Team:  Supervise and guide the hiring team to ensure efficient recruitment processes, timely hiring, and quality candidate selection. Process Improvement:  Evaluate current HR processes related to hiring, onboarding, and employee engagement. Identify areas for improvement and implement strategic changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Strategic Planning:  Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement HR strategies that support the company's goals and objectives. Talent Acquisition:  Develop and implement innovative recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Utilize various sourcing channels, including social media, job portals, and networking events. Candidate Selection:  Oversee the candidate selection process, including screening resumes, conducting interviews, and assessing candidates' suitability for roles. Onboarding and Training:  Ensure smooth onboarding processes for new hires, including orientation programs and training initiatives to facilitate their integration into the organization. Employee Relations:  Handle employee relations issues professionally and promptly, maintaining a positive work environment and resolving conflicts as needed. Compliance:  Stay updated with labor laws, regulations, and HR best practices. Ensure HR policies and procedures comply with legal requirements and industry standards. Data Analysis:  Utilize HR analytics and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to hiring, employee turnover, and retention. Generate reports and provide insights to management for informed decision-making. Team Development:  Coach and mentor HR team members, fostering their professional growth and enhancing team performance. Qualifications and Skills: MBA in HR/Industrial Relations or related field. Proven experience (7-12 years) in HR roles, with a focus on talent acquisition and management. Strong leadership skills with the ability to lead and motivate a team. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret HR data and make data-driven decisions. Knowledge of labor laws, regulations, and compliance requirements. Proficiency in HR software and tools for recruitment, HRIS, and data analysis. Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities. High level of integrity and confidentiality in handling sensitive HR information. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Location:  Chennai, India Benefits: Competitive salary package Health insurance and wellness programs Opportunities for professional development and growth Collaborative and inclusive work culture Chance to work with a leading organization in the industry

column2: Freelance Recruiter Job Overview We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Freelance Recruiter to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and selecting qualified candidates for various positions. This is a remote position, offering flexibility and the opportunity to work with a dynamic and growing company. Key Responsibilities 1. Candidate Sourcing: Utilize various channels such as job boards, social media, and networking events to identify potential candidates. 2. Screening and Interviewing: Conduct initial screenings, interviews, and assessments to evaluate candidates' qualifications and fit for the position. 3. Client Liaison: Work closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and provide regular updates on recruitment progress. 4. Job Posting: Create and post job advertisements on relevant platforms to attract a diverse pool of candidates. 5. Database Management: Maintain a database of potential candidates for future openings and keep records of all recruitment activities. 6. Offer Management: Assist in the negotiation and extension of job offers to selected candidates. 7. Compliance: Ensure all recruitment activities comply with company policies and employment laws. 8. Market Research: Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in recruitment. Qualifications 1. Experience: Proven experience as a recruiter, either in-house or with a staffing agency, preferably in a freelance capacity. 2. Education: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred. Skills: 1. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 2. Strong organizational and time-management abilities 3. Proficiency with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and HR databases 4. Familiarity with various sourcing techniques (e.g., social media recruiting, Boolean search) 5. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously Preferred Attributes 1. Certifications: Professional certifications such as PHR, SPHR, or SHRM-CP are a plus. 2. Technical Proficiency: Experience with HR software and tools, as well as basic computer applications (MS Office Suite). 3. Industry Knowledge: Specific industry knowledge or experience in the sectors we serve (Non IT) is advantageous. Work Environment 1. Remote Work: This is a fully remote position. Flexible Hours: The role offers flexibility in working hours, but may require occasional availability during specific times to coordinate with clients and candidates.

column2: About Department The Human Resources department enables TresVista's people to catalyze our clients impact. The department is responsible for   recruitment, managing compensation and benefits, maximizing employee productivity and wellbeing, reviewing performance,   enhancing employee lifecycle, and other aspects that affect the firm and its people. Talent Acquisition is a function tasked with   chalking out a strategic approach to identifying, assessing, and acquiring skilled employees for meeting organizational needs. Other   than recruitment, the team is responsible for employer branding, future resource planning, diversifying the organizations labor   force, and developing a robust candidate pipeline Overview The Assistant Manager, Talent Acquisition will be responsible for finding, recruiting, and hiring best-in-class talent. They will maintain   effective working relations with stakeholders and implement ideas for improving the Talent Acquisition process and outcomes Roles and Responsibilities   ?? Screening and sourcing potential candidates through job portals to fulfil the firm-wide staffing needs by attracting and   recruiting top-performing employees   ??Ensuring that the top talent in the market is selected through assessment of capabilities, experience, and potential as well as   systematizing the screening process   ??Conducting calibration meetings with stakeholders to help build their team by providing talent acquisition expertise   ??Creating content for various job and social media posts to correspond with candidates via email, calls and in person while   networking and interacting with a variety of people that are important in the recruitment process   ??Acting as the face of the company to candidates, the point of contact for hiring managers, and a liaison between the two   parties throughout the hiring process   ??Planning and scheduling interviews by managing logistical details, determining the time that suits all parties   ??Minimizing the TAT for closing roles by devising and implementing innovative pipeline strategies and implementing efficient   hiring strategies to meet defined KPIs   ??Ensuring defined processes are followed along with following compliance and regulatory guidelines Prerequisites   ?? Attention to detail   ??Excellent command on Excel and PowerPoint   ??Maintaining confidentiality of information   ??Excellent interpersonal, decision-making, and communication skills   ??Extensive understanding of HR databases, applicant tracking systems, and candidate management systems Experience   5 to 8 years of relevant work experience in HR (Talent Acquisition/Recruitment preferred) Education   Graduate in any discipline

column2: Role & responsibilities     1.   Recruitment:  Assist in the recruitment process by posting job vacancies, coordinating interviews, and communicating with candidates and hiring managers. 2.   Onboarding and Orientation:  Assist with onboarding and orientation programs for new employees, ensuring that they receive the necessary information and resources to integrate into the hospital's culture and operations. 3.   Employee Relations:  Provide support in addressing employee concerns, disputes, and inquiries professionally and efficiently, in compliance with hospital policies and employment laws. 4.   Performance Management:  Participate in the performance appraisal process by gathering feedback and data and assisting in addressing performance-related issues. 5.   Compensation and Benefits:  Support compensation and benefits programs by providing data and assisting in managing salary structures, bonuses, and employee benefits. 6.   HR Policies and Procedures:  Assist in the communication and enforcement of HR policies, procedures, and programs, ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations and best practices. 7.   Compliance:  Contribute to ensuring that the hospital remains compliant with all applicable employment laws and healthcare industry regulations. Contribute in making the compliance for internal audit and external audits like NABH, NABL ensuring alignment with the hospital's objectives and compliance requirements. Assist in the preparation of audit reports that include findings, recommendations, and action plans to address identified issues. Collaborate with department heads and staff to ensure that audit recommendations are implemented, and corrective actions are taken to address deficiencies. Maintain organized and secure records of audit documentation, reports and related materials. 8.   Diversity and Inclusion:  Support diversity and inclusion initiatives to create a culturally inclusive and equitable workplace. 9.   HR Technology:  Help to maintain HR information systems and technology, including payroll and timekeeping systems. 10.   Conflict Resolution:  Participate in addressing employee concerns and disputes in a professional and effective manner, seeking resolution while maintaining a positive workplace environment. 11.   Employee Engagement:  Assist in implementing strategies to measure and improve employee engagement, job satisfaction, and organizational culture. 12.   Health and Safety:  Collaborate with occupational health and safety teams to ensure employees work in a safe environment and comply with safety regulations. 13.   Documentation:  Maintain accurate records and documentation related to Recruitment, HR activities, employee files, and compliance records. Preferred candidate profile   Qualification: MBA (HR)   Required Skill Sets: 1. Knowledge of employment laws, healthcare industry regulations, and accreditation standards. 2. Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. 3. Familiarity with MS-Office applications, HR information systems and technology. 4. Basic knowledge of negotiation and conflict resolution skills.

column2: The  Specialized Talent Sourcer  identifies and attracts top candidates with specific skill sets or expertise to fill niche positions. They have a deep understanding of the industry and job requirements they recruit for, and utilize specialized sourcing techniques to effectively match qualified candidates to the defined unique needs of client organizations. Duties and Responsibilities: Collaborating closely with recruiters and hiring managers to understand the unique job requirements and effectively align sourcing efforts with the organizations goals. Reviewing and posting attractive job adverts on specialized job boards to boost the interest from target candidates. Reviewing and processing applications on all platforms in a timely manner. Utilizing various sourcing methods such as online platforms, social media, and networking to identify and connect with potential candidates who possess the specific skills and qualifications required for niche positions. Implementing traditional, creative, and targeted candidate attraction strategies, such as mobile and email campaigns, cold calling, utilization of recruitment marketing,?etc. to cultivate and grow talent?communities for current and future hiring needs, ensuring a steady and engaged pipeline of specialized talent is always available. Engaging with potential candidates through personalized outreach, networking events, and communication channels to establish rapport and interest in job opportunities. Conducting and presenting thorough and regular market research to understand industry trends, salary benchmarks, and talent availability, which helps in planning effective sourcing and hiring strategies. Pre-screening candidates to assess their qualifications, experience, and cultural fit before presenting them to the hiring team. Sharing market and candidate insights to business hiring groups, while consulting them on sourcing and hiring strategies. Actively promoting the employer brand to potential candidates, highlighting the company?? strengths in the specific industry, and opportunities for career growth. Ensuring accurate and up-to-date records of candidate interactions and sourcing activities, using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other available tools. Staying updated with industry best practices, sourcing tools and techniques to continually improve the effectiveness of talent sourcing strategies. Fostering diversity and inclusion by sourcing candidates from diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups, contributing to a more inclusive workforce. Identifying areas for process improvement within the talent sourcing function and suggesting innovative ways to enhance recruitment efficiency. Education: High School diploma required , BTech?degree?is preferred Experience: 3 years??experience in sourcing or recruiting is required. Deep understanding of, and solid sourcing experience in a certain industry (or industries, markets) is required. Exposure: Proficiency in using  specialized sourcing techniques , such as X-Ray, Advanced Boolean, data mining, extensions, and aggregators etc. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  to effectively engage both with candidates and hiring teams. Strong  research and market analysis skills Ability to  handle candidate data  with accuracy, confidentiality, and compliance with data protection regulations. Capability to  manage multiple sourcing tasks and priorities  efficiently, meeting deadlines and handling niche recruitment requirements. Aptitude to  address sourcing challenges  creatively, finding innovative solutions to attract specialized talent. Continuous learning  about industry trends, sourcing best practices, and emerging technologies. Strong  focus on achieving sourcing targets
column11: Sourcing Profiles, Recruitment, Talent Acquisition, Sourcer

column2: Internship Overview Looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Intern to join our Talent Acquisition team. This internship opportunity is ideal for recent Post Graduates (MBA - 2024 passed out) who are interested in gaining hands-on experience in recruitment and talent acquisition. As a Recruitment Intern, you will support our recruitment team in various aspects of the hiring process, including sourcing candidates, screening resumes, and coordinating interviews.  Role & responsibilities   Candidate Sourcing:  Assist in sourcing candidates through online job boards, social media platforms, and other channels. Resume Screening:  Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates for open positions, ensuring alignment with job requirements and qualifications. Candidate Communication:  Reach out to candidates via email or phone to schedule interviews, provide application status updates, and answer basic inquiries about the recruitment process. Interview Coordination:  Assist in coordinating interview schedules between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring all parties are informed and prepared. Data Management:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system (ATS), including application status, interview feedback, and other relevant information. Employer Branding:  Contribute ideas and content to enhance the company's employer brand on social media platforms and other recruitment channels. Administrative Support:  Provide general administrative support to the recruitment team, including filing paperwork, organizing candidate profiles, and preparing interview materials. Learning and Development:  Take advantage of learning opportunities to gain knowledge of recruitment best practices, applicant tracking systems, and relevant laws and regulations. Preferred candidate profile   Currently enrolled in a Master's degree program in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field. Must be a passed out of 2024. Strong interest in pursuing a career in recruitment or talent acquisition. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Word and Excel. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Internship period - 3 months.
column11: MBA, HR, TA, Talent Acquisition

We work with NSE registered companies to develop E-Commerce applications, ERP systems, CRMs and other large scale applications. Job Description The ideal candidate should have minimum experience of 1 year and should be familiar with Technical Recruitment in Software Development (prior experience in recruiting MERN technologies is preferred but not mandatory).  English communication skills should be excellent. Other good to have skills will be payroll policies, HR contracts and company policies. If not adept at these HR skills, you will be given training during orientation period at the company. column2: The HR Talent Acquisition Recruiter will be responsible for managing the full recruitment cycle, including identifying and sourcing potential candidates, conducting interviews, and evaluating candidates to ensure the best fit for the company. column2: An HR Recruiter at IndiaFilings would play a crucial role in identifying, attracting, and hiring the best talent for the company. Here are the key responsibilities and duties typically associated with an HR Recruiter role at IndiaFilings: 1. Talent Acquisition Job Posting:  Create and post job advertisements on various job boards, social media platforms, and the companys website. Sourcing Candidates:  Use various sourcing methods such as databases, social media, and employee referrals to find suitable candidates. Resume Screening:  Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates. 2. Interview Coordination Interview Scheduling:  Coordinate and schedule interviews with candidates and hiring managers. Conduct Interviews:  Conduct initial phone screens and participate in in-person interviews to assess candidate qualifications. Feedback Collection:  Gather and relay feedback from interviewers to candidates and vice versa. 3. Candidate Management Applicant Tracking:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the applicant tracking system (ATS). Communication:  Communicate effectively with candidates throughout the recruitment process, providing timely updates and feedback. Offer Negotiation:  Assist in the negotiation of job offers and preparation of employment contracts. 4. Employer Branding Company Representation:  Represent IndiaFilings at job fairs, career events, and networking functions. Brand Promotion:  Promote the companys reputation as a great place to work through social media and other platforms. 5. Collaboration with Hiring Managers Requirement Gathering:  Work closely with hiring managers to understand job requirements and qualifications. Job Description Development:  Assist in the development and refinement of job descriptions. Interview Panel Coordination:  Ensure that the interview panel is well-prepared and briefed on the requirements and selection criteria. 6. Recruitment Strategy Market Research:  Conduct research on industry trends and salary benchmarks to ensure competitive compensation packages. Process Improvement:  Continuously improve recruitment processes and strategies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Metrics and Reporting:  Track recruitment metrics such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and source effectiveness, and prepare regular reports for management. 7. Onboarding Onboarding Coordination:  Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the company. Documentation:  Ensure all necessary documentation is completed and filed in accordance with company policies and legal requirements. 8. Compliance Regulatory Adherence:  Ensure all recruitment practices comply with labor laws and regulations. Diversity and Inclusion:  Promote diversity and inclusion in the hiring process. Skills and Qualifications Education:  Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field. Experience:  Previous experience as an HR Recruiter or in a similar role. Skills:  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, proficiency in using applicant tracking systems and recruitment software, and excellent organizational and time-management abilities. Attributes:  High level of professionalism, discretion, and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team. These responsibilities are essential for ensuring that IndiaFilings attracts and retains the best talent, thereby contributing to the companys overall success and growth. OFFICE ADDRESS :  IndiaFilings Pvt Ltd ( EQL FinTech) RR Towers 4, 8th Floor, TVK Industrial Estate, Guindy - 600032
column11: Naukri, Sourcing Profiles, HR Consulting, Hiring, Sourcing, Recruitment Consulting, Recruitment

column2: We are looking for HR Recruiter Manager who can create Moris Media s    Globally Recruitment Strategies    to achieve the organizations goals. She is in charge of creating and carrying out the organizations recruitment strategies. The HR recruiter will carry out recruitment strategies and find the best people to fill open vacancies in the company.     Finding qualified people who will benefit the Moris Media. An excellent HR recruiter should be connected to others in the field and know how to use social media to find qualified candidates for open positions now and in the future.           Identify hiring needs:    Work closely with management to understand the hiring needs and develop an understanding of the job requirements.       Develop job descriptions:    Create job descriptions and job postings that accurately reflect the requirements of the position, including the essential skills, qualifications, and experience.     Source candidates: Use various channels such as job boards, social media, and recruiting agencies to source candidates who meet the job requirements.       Review resumes:    Review resumes and applications to identify qualified candidates and screen them based on the job requirements.       Conduct interviews:    Conduct interviews with candidates to assess their qualifications, experience, and fit for the job.       Coordinate with hiring management:    Coordinate with hiring management to schedule interviews, share feedback on candidates, and develop the hiring strategy.       Manage the hiring process:    Manage the entire hiring process, from the initial screening to the final offer.       Maintain communication:    Keep candidates and management informed throughout the hiring process, ensuring that communication is timely, professional, and consistent.       Check references:    Verify employment and education history, check references, and conduct background checks as required.       Negotiate job offers:    Negotiate job offers with successful candidates and finalize the terms of employment.       Maintain compliance:    Ensure that all relevant laws and regulations governing the hiring process are followed, including EEOC, OFCCP, and ADA regulations.       Evaluate recruitment strategies:    Evaluate recruitment strategies and identify areas for improvement to attract top talent.               Education:    A Bachelors degree in Human Resources or a related field is typically required       Experience:    Relevant work experience in recruitment, human resources, or a related field is preferred. Some organizations may require specific experience with certain job positions, industries or skill sets.       Knowledge and Skills:    Candidates should have a strong understanding of recruitment best practices, job description development, and HR policies and procedures. In addition, they should possess excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, and time-management skills.         Summary,    MBA preferred), Bachelors degree in Human Resources or a related field is typically required, and relevant work experience in recruitment or HR is preferred. she should have a strong understanding of recruitment best practices, HR policies and procedures, and possess excellent communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, and time-management skills.             Communication skills:    HR Recruiter must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with candidates, hiring managers, and other stakeholders.       Interpersonal skills:    Building relationships and working collaboratively with hiring managers, recruiters, and candidates is a critical part of the job, so HR Recruiters must have strong interpersonal skills.       Time management:    HR Recruiters need to manage multiple tasks and deadlines, so the ability to prioritize work, manage time effectively, and remain organized is essential.       Problem-solving:    HR Recruiters must be able to think critically, analyze data, and make informed decisions to solve problems that arise during the hiring process.       Adaptability:    The ability to adapt to changing priorities, job requirements, and recruitment strategies is critical in this role.       Attention to detail:    HR Recruiters must be detail-oriented and maintain a high level of accuracy in candidate screening, resume reviews, and job postings.       Knowledge of recruitment laws:    HR Recruiters should have a strong understanding of employment laws, including EEOC, OFCCP, and ADA regulations.       Sales and marketing skills:    HR Recruiters need to be able to "sell" the job and the company to candidates, so they should have some marketing and sales skills.       Technology skills:    HR Recruiters must have proficiency with HR information systems, applicant tracking systems, and other recruitment technologies.       Analytical skills:    HR Recruiters should have analytical skills to measure and evaluate recruitment strategies and metrics to make data-driven decisions.
column11: Analytical skills, Interpersonal skills, Sales, Time management, Social media, HR policies, HR, Management, Marketing

column2: As part of the global Talent Acquisition team, this is a key strategic role within Third Bridge. With plans to expand our Mumbai office, this role will be critical in identifying and recruiting the best talent into our teams across multiple disciplines.      You will be responsible for working with the local leadership team to design strategic sourcing initiatives, ensuring that robust selection and assessment processes are in place.      With overall responsibility for driving the pipeline generation for our Mumbai office, you will be passionate about candidate experience and be proactive in promoting our employer brand across the local market via multiple channels.        The core responsibilities of this role include:        Managing the end to end recruitment life cycle      Sourcing and shortlist candidates using various recruitment channels, developing sourcing strategies with the business for each role      Maintaining a thorough understanding of Third Bridge and our business model to enable you to identify, attract, assess and retain talent      Conducting phone and face to face interview      Developing and managing consultative relationships with Hiring Managers, providing a high level of client service to internal stakeholders and partners      Supporting global talent acquisition projects and employer brand activities      Qualifications        Hold an undergraduate degree          Strong experience with active and passive sourcing          Previous background of a 360 recruitment role would is desired but this may come from either and RPO or internal role          Eligible to work in the India without requiring sponsorship            What you ll need:            Previous experience within an end to end talent acquisition role where you ll have successfully sourced candidates across various business functions using multiple channels. We re looking for someone who is proactive, and self-managing who can develop strong stakeholder relationships and deliver exceptional candidates experiences.          you ll need to take pride in everything that you do, sourcing, selecting and assessing top talent for our business.          Of course, you ll also need excellent communication and presentation skills, able to position yourself as a subject matter expert while also being open to receiving feedback which will help us to continue to improve and evolve as a talent acquisition team.

column2: An Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager is a professional who supports the recruitment and personnel management functions within an organization     They assist the Recruitment/Personnel Manager in attracting, selecting, and managing a qualified workforce       Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of an Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager:       Recruitment support: The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager assists in the recruitment process by posting job advertisements, reviewing resumes, conducting initial screenings, scheduling interviews, and coordinating candidate assessments     They may also participate in interviews and provide feedback on candidate suitability     Onboarding and orientation: They help facilitate the onboarding process for new employees, ensuring that necessary paperwork is completed, conducting orientation sessions, and assisting with the introduction of new hires to the organization's policies, procedures, and culture     HR documentation and records: The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager maintains accurate and up-to-date personnel records, including employee contracts, offer letters, benefits enrollment forms, and other HR-related documentation     They ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements     Employee relations: They assist in handling employee inquiries and addressing concerns related to HR policies, benefits, and procedures     The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager may also participate in investigations and disciplinary processes when necessary, in collaboration with the HR team and management     HR policies and procedures: They support the implementation and enforcement of HR policies, procedures, and guidelines across the organization     The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager helps communicate policy updates, ensures adherence to employment laws and regulations, and promotes a positive work environment     Training and development: They contribute to employee development initiatives by identifying training needs, coordinating training programs, and assisting in the evaluation of training effectiveness     The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager may also help track employee performance reviews and provide input for performance management processes     HR data and reporting: They compile HR-related data and prepare reports on various HR metrics, such as recruitment statistics, turnover rates, and training participation     The Assistant Recruitment/Personnel Manager may also assist in analyzing HR data to identify trends and make recommendations for improvement

column2: We are looking for an HR recruiter to identify, attract, and recruit top talent who embody the values and possess the skills required to uphold and enhance the Asian Heart Institutes reputation as Indias #1 cardiac hospital, thereby contributing to our mission of providing world-class care.            Develop and Implement a Strategic Recruitment Plan: Create a 12-month recruitment strategy that aligns with the hospital s staffing needs, focusing on critical medical and non-medical roles.            Attract A-Player Candidates: Increase the number of qualified applicants by 50% within the first six months through targeted recruitment campaigns, social media engagement, and partnerships with leading schools and associations.            Improve Hiring Metrics: Achieve a candidate-to-hire conversion rate of 20%, reduce the average time-to-fill for critical positions to 90 days for senior positions (managers and above, consultant doctors) and 60 days for others.            Enhance Employer Branding: Collaborate with the marketing department to strengthen the hospital s employer brand, ensuring it reflects a commitment to excellence, innovation, and compassionate care, leading to a 20% increase in unsolicited top-tier candidate inquiries.            Implement a Robust Talent Assessment Framework: Implement a comprehensive talent evaluation process that includes competency-based interviews, practical assessments, and reference checks to ensure candidates meet the high standards required for roles at the Institute.                  Competencies          You possess the following attributes:        Ownership. You never say, that s not my job . You act on behalf of the entire company, not just your own team.        Highest Standards. You have relentlessly high standards and are continually driving your team to deliver high-quality service and processes.        Deliver Results. You focus on key inputs for your team and deliver them with the right quality and on time. Despite setbacks, you persevere and never settle.        Teamwork. You promote collaboration and ensure open communication, making every member feel valued.          Growth Mindset. You find ways to convert problems to opportunities and demonstrate resilience, realistic optimism, and adaptability to change.        Communication. You possess exceptional verbal and written communication skills for engaging with candidates, hiring managers, and stakeholders effectively.        Analytical Skills. You are proficient in analyzing recruitment metrics to inform strategies, improve processes, and make data-driven decisions.        Recruitment. You have planned, built and executed recruitment pipelines to bring A+ talent into your organizations.        Requirements          A minimum of 1 year of experience with talent acquisition      MBA with HR specialization preferred      Healthcare or Hospital Industry background preferred .

column2: We are looking for a deadline-focused technical recruiter to be responsible for the sourcing, screening, and hiring of technical specialists to fill IT positions. The technical recruiters responsibilities include all aspects of hiring, from meeting with hiring managers to write job descriptions to offering job positions to the most suitable candidates. You should be focused, hard-working, and able to meet deadlines to the satisfaction of all parties involved.     To be a successful technical recruiter, you should have a good working knowledge of technology, technical roles, and technical skills, as well as knowledge of the recruitment process.           Technical Recruiter Responsibilities:         Communicating with hiring managers to identify future job openings and the technical requirements for those jobs. column2: Habitat for Humanity International is looking for an pandemic. The consultant will work hand in hand with the HR team whileindividual consultant to support its recruitment efforts as it emerges from the global? undertaking the end to end recruitment process.        Scope of work:        The Recruitment Consultant s role and responsibilities include the following:              Work with hiring managers on the requisition documents (Position Description, Position Request Form and Funding Form) and approvals              Coordinate selection criteria with hiring managers and prepare interview guide templates              Post job advertisement in various sourcing platforms used by Habitat for Humanity India              Review CV s or source directly from available sourcing platforms and network              Provide long list to the hiring manager and coordinate the shortlist of candidates              Schedule interviews and facilitate knowledge tests, when applicable              Conduct phone screen interviews and submit interview notes and score sheets in a timely manner              Coordinate with HR team on the conduct of reference checks and record maintenance              Work with hiring managers and the HR Director on setting up offer ranges and seeking approvals              Facilitate offer to selected candidate              Undertake recruitment due diligence (reference, background, education and security checks)              Ensure compliance with Habitat for Humanity International and Habitat for Humanity India s standards, policies and practices                  Effort and duration                The consultant will plan work on a monthly basis and coordinate the implementation of the work plan with the HR Director on a weekly basis. The weekly coordination will be an opportunity to adjust the plan as necessary. This engagement is based in the Mumbai office.              This is a 3-month fixed-term consultancy, with a possibility of extension up to 6 months              Consultant will be on professional services agreement (PSA) contract reporting to the HR Director, Habitat for Humanity India              Will be subjected to HFHI s confidentiality and data privacy consent/agreements              HFHI will provide laptop and habitat.org email address                  Service fees and payment              The consultant will plan work on a monthly basis and coordinate the implementation of the work plan with the supervisor on a weekly basis. The weekly coordination will be an opportunity to adjust the plan as necessary.              A fixed professional service fee including taxes will be billed monthly by the consultant including a timesheet to present the hours worked and accomplishments per week and approved by Supervisor                  Required qualifications of lead consultant                Bachelor s degree / Master s degree degree (In India people tend to have a Masters degree for for good employment opportunities. Moreover, we may not get quality candidates just with a bachelors degree.              At least 5 years experience as a recruiter of entry level up to leadership roles              Familiarity of the India labor context is required              Excellent communications skills              Ability to work independently.              Familiarity with the INGO and development sector              Ability to leverage the network and LinkedIn platform

column2: The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the full recruitment life cycle. You will work closely with managers to understand the company s hiring needs, meet competitive hiring goals and expectations, and help management find, hire, and retain quality talent. You will also help to grow and foster high-touch relationships with a database of qualified active and passive talent to pull from as new positions open up.      Objectives of this Role:      Work closely with managers to gain a comprehensive understanding of the company s hiring needs for each position, and meet competitive hiring goals and expectations      Manage the full recruitment life cycle across a variety of open roles, helping management find, hire, and retain quality talent      Grow and foster high-touch relationships with a database of qualified active and passive talent to pull from as new positions open up      Continuously partner with recruiting team and senior managers to design, refine, and implement innovative recruiting strategies        Daily and Weekly Responsibilities:      Work and form relationships with internal management teams to know the ins and outs of their departments and better understand their hiring needs and job specifications      Develop and release job postings on platforms such as social media and job boards      Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and execute innovative recruiting strategies to find quality candidates and prospect for new business      Screen resumes and candidates, qualify, interview, and manage candidates throughout interview process from prepping before interviews to assisting with final offer negotiation      Maintain a database of candidate records, including active and passive prospects, and hired and fired employees      Follow up on interview process status and update records in internal database        Skills and Qualifications:      Bachelor s degree in Human Resource Management or related field preferred      Advanced knowledge of MS Office, database management, and internet search      Familiarity with job boards, HR software, databases, and management systems      Proven experience conducting various types of interviews (i.e., phone, video, etc.)      Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and decision-making skills      4-9 years of experience in recruitment or human resources

column2: Attention Job Seekers! Join Our Growing Team! Note: All are nightshift Jobs. Timings is from 6:30 PM - 3:30 AM. Its an onsite job. No remote option.     We are a fast-growing and dynamic company seeking talented individuals to fill the following positions: US IT Recruiter US Healthcare Recruiter Bench Sales Recruiter Account Manager About Us:  We are a leading firm in the IT industry, specializing in providing top-notch services and solutions to our clients. Our success is built on a strong foundation of teamwork, innovation, and dedication to excellence. As we continue to expand, we are looking for motivated and skilled individuals to join our family and contribute to our continued success. Position: US Recruiter  Are you passionate about connecting talented professionals with exciting job opportunities? As a US Recruiter, you will play a crucial role in sourcing, screening, and selecting the best candidates to meet our clients' requirements. If you have excellent communication skills, a strong understanding on IT/ Health care/Medical/Pharma roles, and a desire to excel in the recruitment field, we want to hear from you! Position: Bench Sales Recruiter  Are you a go-getter who thrives in a fast-paced environment? Join our team as a Bench Sales Recruiter and help bridge the gap between our consultants and prospective clients. Your ability to build and maintain relationships will be key to success in this role. If you have a passion for sales and enjoy working in a dynamic atmosphere, apply today! Position: Account Manager  Are you having exceptional communication and negotiation skills? As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for nurturing and growing our client relationships. Your ability to understand client needs, provide solutions, and ensure client satisfaction will be critical to excelling in this role. Join our team and take your account management career to the next level! Why Work with Us? Opportunities for career growth and advancement A collaborative and supportive work environment Competitive salary and performance-based incentives Comprehensive training and development programs Employee benefits package A chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and industry leaders Requirements: For Freshers: No prior experience required; comprehensive training will be provided For Experienced Candidates: Relevant experience in the respective field is preferred Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities A passion for learning and personal development How to Apply:  Ready to take the next step in your career journey? Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Send your updated resume and a brief cover letter to  alex@sonussoftwareinc.com  Please mention the position you are applying for in the subject line of your email. Join our team and become part of a company that values its employees and believes in their potential to achieve greatness. Sonus Software Solutions PVT LTD http://www.sonussoftwareinc.com   Phone #:   +91 7416597667 Office Address: 57-06, Mallikarjuna Nagar, Revenue Ward No 32, Rajahmundry, Pin:533101, East Godavari Land Mark: Near YMCA Hall, Opp: John Wesly House

column2: Evolet Healthcare Pvt. Ltd. is seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our team as a Talent Acquisition Executive.  The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, attracting, and hiring top talent to support our company's growth and objectives. In nutshell, managing the comprehensive Talent Acquisition Process.   Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies. Source, screen, and assess candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking, and employee referrals, with expertise in extracting profiles from portals using candidate search and Boolean search techniques. Create job descriptions and specifications tailored to each role's requirements. Utilize sourcing strategies such as headhunting, social media sites, referrals, speculative sourcing, job portals, and personal recruiter networks. Conducting Telephonic Interviews, afterwards, First round of face-to-face interviews and arranging further final rounds of interviews with HR & Respective Department's Manager. Maintaining the score card for shortlisted candidates to finalize the best job fit aspirant. Perform reference and background checks as required telephonically and via email. Document and report the entire recruitment process, maintaining recruitment records and candidate databases. Build a strong pipeline of potential candidates for current and future talent requirements. Coordinate and generate LOI, offer letters & employment agreement for hired candidates. Handle and manage the training and development process for all employees. Conduct employee engagement activities to foster a positive work environment.  Handling exit process of employees effectively as per the company policies. Administering other HR functions along with the admin and HR Manager. Qualifications:  Must be post-graduate in MBA-HR Specialization  1-3 years of experience in recruitment functions for any corporate setting.  Strong negotiation & convincing skills.  Experience in Excel is a must, with fair knowledge in operating other Microsoft Office Suite applications.  Good exposure to good hiring processes  Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.  Comfortable working within stringent deadlines.  Quick learner with the ability to work independently. Benefits:  Health Insurance  PF benefits  Professional development opportunities  Vibrant and inclusive company culture
