column2: Talent Acquisition Intern  Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. Gurugram,  India Shift: 11:00 am  08:00 pm  As a Talent Acquisition Apprentice, you will be immersed in the world of recruiting and talent acquisition, gaining hands-on experience in conducting phone screens, and learning how to contribute on various aspects of the recruitment cycle.  Key Responsibilities:  ??Assist in screening candidates using various recruiting platforms and techniques.  ??Support the recruitment team in managing job postings on various job boards and company websites.  ??Support the coordination of interviews and assessments for potential candidates.  ??Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in our applicant tracking system.  ??Assist in the creation and posting of job advertisements on job boards.  ??Conduct initial phone screenings to assess candidate qualifications and fit for open positions.  ??Provide administrative support to the Talent Acquisition team as needed.  ??Communicate with candidates regarding their application status.  ??Assist in creating and sharing content for job boards, and other platforms to attract candidates.  ??Prepare recruitment related documents and reports.  ??Assist in other HR-related projects as needed.  Qualifications: ??Bachelors degree in human resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)  ??Strong passion for talent acquisition and interest in pursuing a career in HR/recruiting.  ??Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  ??Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.  ??Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.  ??Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group  At Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group, we understand the value of opportunity  for our clients and our team. Independent and employee-owned, we partner with investment professionals to grow successful asset management businesses, giving them the space to innovate and truly make an impact.  With more than 40 years of history and offices across Canada and in the US, the UK and India, CC&L Financial Group and our multi-boutique family of affiliate firms collectively manage over $127 billion in assets, providing a diverse range of traditional and alternative investment products and solutions to institutional, high-net-worth and retail clients.  For a closer look at how you can build your career with us, we invite you to explore cclgroup.com. CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.  To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF. We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

column2: Dear Candidate, Reelay Group is hiring for Talent Acquisition /Assistant Manager HR Location: Gurgaon (Near Huda City Metro Station) Experience: 04  05 Years Job Summary: The Mid-Level HR will be responsible for managing the full-cycle recruitment process for a variety of roles, including technical (IT) and non-technical positions. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in recruiting for diverse roles, strong sourcing abilities, and excellent relationship-building skills. Key Responsibilities: Recruitment Process Management: Manage end-to-end recruitment processes for both IT and non-IT positions, from job posting and sourcing to interviewing and hiring. Sourcing: Leverage multiple sourcing channels such as job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals to attract a diverse pool of candidates. Screening: Conduct initial phone screenings and in-depth interviews to assess candidates' qualifications, technical skills, and cultural fit. Coordination: Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers, ensuring a seamless and positive candidate experience. Liaison with the HR Operations/Administration/IT/Learning & Development Team to ensure they are kept informed of all new hires and joining dates and respective inputs. Data Management: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records in the system and generate recruitment reports as needed and release letter and manage admin task. Compliance: Ensure that recruitment practices comply with all applicable employment laws and regulations. Administration - To review and support Team Administration to manage the key deliverables including Communication & Office Management. Qualifications & Skills: Education: Bachelor?? degree in Human Resources or a related field. Experience: 4-5 years of recruitment experience, with a focus on both IT and non-IT roles. Strong understanding of technical and non-technical recruitment processes and techniques. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with specific recruitment software or tools relevant to IT and non-IT hiring. Interested candidate with relevant experience can share their updated resume on aruna.bhalla@reelay.in

column2: Talent Sourcing: Actively source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and employee referrals.     Job Posting: Create and post job descriptions on company websites, job boards, and other relevant platforms.     Candidate Screening: Review resumes, conduct initial candidate assessments, and screen applicants to identify individuals who meet the job requirements.     Interviewing: Conduct interviews with candidates, assessing their skills, experience, and cultural fit with the organization.     Candidate Relationship Management: Build and maintain relationships with candidates to keep them engaged throughout the recruitment process.     Collaboration: Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs, including job requirements, expectations, and team dynamics.     Recruitment Strategy: Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract a diverse pool of candidates.     Offer Management: Extend job offers to selected candidates, negotiate terms, and coordinate the offer acceptance process.     Onboarding: Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.     Data Management: Maintain applicant tracking systems and databases, ensuring accurate and up-to-date records of candidate interactions and progress.     Compliance: Ensure compliance with employment laws, regulations, and company policies throughout the recruitment process.     Reporting: Prepare and present recruitment metrics and reports to measure the effectiveness of the recruitment process.         Skills and Qualifications:         Recruitment Expertise: Proficiency in recruitment best practices and strategies.     Communication: Strong communication skills for interacting with candidates and hiring managers.     Interviewing: Experience in conducting effective interviews and assessments.     Sourcing: Ability to proactively source candidates through various channels.     Relationship Building: Strong relationship-building skills to engage and nurture candidate relationships.

column2: Job Summary:  The HR Executive is a key member of the Human Resources team, supporting the organization in various HR functions and initiatives. This role involves recruiting and onboarding new employees, managing employee relations, administering benefits and compensation programs, and ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations. The HR Executive also plays a role in performance management, training and development, and fostering a positive work culture within the organization. Responsibilities: Recruitment      and Onboarding: Coordinate recruitment efforts, including posting job       openings, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and conducting       reference checks. Facilitate the onboarding process for new hires,       including orientation and training programs. Employee      Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee inquiries and       concerns, providing guidance and support as needed. Assist in resolving employee conflicts or issues,       promoting a positive work environment. Benefits      and Compensation: Administer employee benefits programs, including       health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks. Assist in managing compensation structures and       processes, ensuring fairness and competitiveness. Compliance: Stay up-to-date with relevant employment laws and regulations,       ensuring company compliance. Maintain accurate employee records and documentation,       adhering to data privacy and security standards. Performance      Management: Support performance appraisal processes, providing       guidance to managers and employees. Assist in identifying training and development needs,       coordinating training programs as necessary. HR      Administration: Handle day-to-day HR administrative tasks, such as       maintaining HRIS records, preparing reports, and managing HR-related       documentation. Assist in developing and implementing HR policies and       procedures. Qualifications: Bachelor's      degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Proven      experience in HR roles, with knowledge of HR best practices and employment      laws. Strong      communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build positive      relationships. Excellent      organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficiency      in HR software and Microsoft Office applications. Additional Requirements: Ability      to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with      discretion. Flexibility      to adapt to changing priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. Commitment      to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.

column2: ,,Position Title:   Talent Acquisition & HR Operation Specialist Location:  Shalimar Bagh- Delhi       Report to:  HR Manager (USA) About The Firm:  Sai CPA Services is a leading and dynamic Certified Public Accountant (CPA) firm committed to delivering high-quality financial services to our clients. With a focus on innovation, integrity, and client satisfaction, we provide a wide range of accounting, tax, payroll, and advisory services to businesses and individuals.  Job Summary:  The HR specialist is responsible for managing end-to-end recruitment and day-to-day HR processes. This role involves sourcing, attracting, interviewing, onboarding, HR administration, benefits administration, payroll processing and compliance with HR policies and regulations. Job Responsibilities : Sourcing and Recruitment: Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and referrals. Conduct pre-screening interviews to assess candidate qualifications and fit. Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers. Communicate effectively with candidates, providing timely feedback and updates throughout the recruitment process. Maintain a strong talent pipeline for current and future hiring needs.   Onboarding: Facilitate a smooth onboarding process for new hires, including conducting background checks and preparing offer letters. Ensure all new hire paperwork is completed and filed appropriately. Coordinate with all departments to ensure new hires are properly onboarded.   HR Administration: Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and HR databases. Handle employee inquiries regarding HR policies, procedures, and programs. Prepare and process HR documents, including employment contracts, new hire paperwork, and termination documents. Assist in the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures. Provide support for performance management, training, and development programs. Assist in HR data analysis and reporting to support decision-making.   Payroll and Benefits Administration: Assist with payroll processing, ensuring timely and accurate payment of employee salaries and wages. Administer employee benefits programs, including annual bonus, retention bonus, retirement plans, and other benefits. Address employee questions and issues related to payroll and benefits.   Employee Relations: Support the HR team in handling employee relations issues, including investigations and conflict resolution. Promote a positive and inclusive workplace culture. Assist in organizing employee engagement activities and events. Job Specifications:   1. Qualification - MBA in HR   2. Experience - Min. 5 yrs. in recruitment & HR operations.   3. Strong understanding of HR practices, policies, HRIS, payroll and employment laws.   4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.   5. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. How to Apply:  Email - hr@saicpaservices.com   Mobile /WhatsApp - 9810382449

column2: The Lead Talent Acquisition position at Trask is responsible for the successful execution of global recruitment strategies, processes, and tools. The successful candidate will be able to plan and manage all recruiting activities and source, screen, interview, evaluate, and select qualified candidates. The ideal candidate will possess extensive knowledge of industry best practices and possess a history of achieving best in class metrics within the talent acquisition space. The candidate should have the ability to establish strong relationships with hiring managers and to coach them on the best practices in the execution of the recruitment life cycle. This fast paced position requires strong organizational and communication skills, as well as the ability to solve problems and think strategically. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual who can provide innovative solutions to help Trask stay ahead in the ever-changing recruitment landscape.     ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:     1. Develop, implement and manage short- and long-term talent acquisition strategies that are aligned with companys goals and objectives.     2. Create and maintain a system for identifying, screening, and interviewing the most qualified talent for current and future needs of the company.     3. Identify and source potential candidates through different resources such as job boards, college recruitment programs, referrals, networking, and other recruitment methods.     4. Network in professional associations and attend job fairs to stay informed about current trends in recruiting and hiring processes.     5. Make employment decisions, including whether candidates meet the minimum and core criteria for the position and if the candidate is a right cultural fit with the organization.     6. Lead onboarding processes to ensure successful transition of new hires into the company.     7. Develop and present talent acquisition related reports to the leadership team.     8. Develop partnerships with hiring managers to understand their hiring needs and manage the recruitment process from start to finish.     9. Analyze and assess the effectiveness of current recruitment strategies and recommend improvements.     10. Stay up-to-date on legal regulations and ensure compliance
column11: Networking, Compliance, Talent acquisition, Lead Talent Acquisition, Legal, Transition, Management, Recruitment

column2: Job Description: We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented HR Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of HR processes and procedures and will be responsible for performing various HR-related tasks. The HR Executive will work closely with the HR Manager to ensure smooth and efficient HR operations. Responsibilities: 1. Assist with recruitment and onboarding processes, including job postings, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and conducting orientation sessions. 2. Maintain employee records and ensure all HR databases and systems are up-to-date and accurate. 3. Handle employee queries and provide timely and effective responses. 4. Assist in the implementation of HR policies and procedures and ensure compliance with relevant labor laws and regulations. 5. Coordinate employee performance evaluations and facilitate feedback sessions. 6. Assist with employee relations matters, including conflict resolution and disciplinary actions. 7. Coordinate employee training and development programs. 8. Assist in the administration of employee benefits programs, including enrollment and claims processing. 9. Prepare HR-related reports and presentations for management as required. 10. Assist with other HR projects and initiatives as needed. Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or a related field. 2. Proven work experience as an HR Executive or similar role. 3. Sound knowledge of HR processes, procedures, and best practices. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 5. Strong organizational and time-management skills. 6. Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion. 7. Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Benefits: - Competitive salary package. - Opportunity for growth and advancement within the company.

column2: An experienced recruiter who has experience working within Information Technology (IT) recruiting, preferably with exposure in US hiring process.      It s a challenging, fast-moving candidate-driven market, and the ideal candidate should be highly motivated and tenacious enough to keep up with the pace.      We are looking for someone who is willing to learn and keep up-to-date with the latest technological developments that influence our technology hiring needs.      This candidate will also be a team player who will extend support in bulk hiring requirements in ITes whenever needed. If you are looking to take your career to the next level and maximize your growth potential then this is the right opportunity for you.      This is an Individual contributor role, based out of Chennai with Hybrid work arrangements.        JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES        Source senior level, highly specialist candidates for global businesses, covering the India and US markets. Explore multiple avenues to source right candidates (active / passive).      Screen and interview candidates to ensure we put forward the best quality candidates to hiring managers. Providing effective briefings to the candidates about the roles and opportunities.      Consult with hiring managers on overall hiring strategies and tailor your approach accordingly      Keep up-to-date with latest industry trends to ensure candidates can be evaluated against industry standard assessments      Network online and offline with potential candidates to promote our employer brand and ensure we attract the best professionals      Deliver on business targets and meet overall quality parameters      Handle volume as well as lateral hiring      Closure on position in the given TAT and budget      Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection and pre-joing process.            KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES        Proven work experience in recruitment - ideally as a Technical Recruiter for India and US market      Hands-on experience with various interview formats (e.g. Teams, Zoom,)      Technical expertise with an ability to understand and explain job requirements for IT roles      Experience using LinkedIn and other social media to source quality candidates      Experience in sourcing quality candidate from headhunting, passive hiring, social/professional network, LinkedIn and other social platforms.      Excellent verbal and written communication skills      Strong tenacity and ability to build a solid network.              EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE          Bachelor or Master in any streams preferably from HR, Marketing, Communication related courses.      5+ years of Total experience with minimum 2 years IT or Tech recruitment experience          Excellent communication skills

column2: Jr. Recruiter - Pharma US   Staffing SPECTRAFORCE was founded in 2004 and is now one of the largest staffing firms in the United States. We set up operations and support staffing in India to better serve many of the US-based industries of which SPECTRAFORCE clients are a part, including Finance, IT, Energy/Utilities, Pharma/Life Sciences, and Business and Professional Services. Our world-class Indian team is essential to the continuous expansion of our global sales and delivery. A Global Staffing and IT company, SPECTRAFORCE is human-to-human driven. Its branding tagline, NEWJOBPHORIA, encompasses the excitement generated within people by matching them with jobs that align on multiple levels: skills, motivation, and environment. As a certified Minority Business Enterprise, SPECTRAFORCE celebrates how different perspectives benefit our employees, services, and community. We focus on cultivating a diverse and inclusive work environment that encourages collaboration and connection. Together, these unique perspectives bring great offerings that deliver state- of-the-art services to our clients and employees. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for the complete recruiting life cycle including updating job boards, direct sourcing activities, preliminary phone interviewing, and negotiation of compensation packages. Recruiting through job search engines, existing candidate relationships, referrals, and other sourcing techniques. Screening candidates based on the requirements specified by the department head or manager. Maintaining regular communication with candidates from the first contact till the release of offer letters. Coordinating salary expectations, negotiations, benefits, and interviews. Conducting reference checks to validate the authenticity of the candidates. Good understanding of W2, 1099 and Corp to Corp. Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:   B Pharma/B.Sc. Biotechnology/BSC Microbiology/BSC Biology and any other medical degree would be preferred. Positive, flexible & assertive work approach. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written). Ability to work independently with minimum supervision in a fast-paced agency environment. A strong will to learn and stay up to date with new technologies. Professional, adaptable, and resilient - ability to withstand setbacks, yet apply 100% effort throughout the workday. Goal-oriented and ambitious. Advanced computer skills, especially in MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and MS Outlook. A highly motivated individual and a quick learner of complex technologies and tools. Must have demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines. Willing to work night shifts. Benefits & Perks: 1. Incentives* 2. Monetary Awards* 3. 5-Year Retention Bonus 4. Referral Policy* 5. Internet Reimbursement* 6. Router UPS Reimbursement* 7. Term Life Insurance 8.   Accidental Insurance 9. Group Medical Insurance (Family Floater) 12. Sodexo Benefit 13. Leave Policy   14. column2: Role & responsibilities     We are seeking a talented and motivated People Specialists to join our growing team. The incumbent will play a crucial role in sourcing, attracting, hiring & managing the top talent for our Sales team, specifically focusing on roles such as Interim Sales Representatives (ISRs) and Upcountry Sales Representatives (USRs) across the North 1 zone, encompassing Delhi, Jammu & Kashmir, Chandigarh, Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal Pradesh. Responsibilities 1.  Recruitment Strategy:  Develop and execute effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates for ISRs and USRs positions, ensuring a robust pipeline of talent. 2.  Sourcing:  Utilize various channels, including market work, job boards, social media, networking, and referrals, to source potential candidates. 3.  Screening and Selection:  Review resumes, conduct initial screenings, and coordinate interviews with the Territory Sales Incharge / Area Sales Managers / Regional Sales Managers to identify candidates who meet the business requirements and cultural fit of the organization. 4.  Candidate Management:  Manage the candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, ensuring clear communication, timely feedback, and a positive impression of the company.  5.  Operational Support:  Provide operational support required for engagement with the hired talent. This can include (but not limited to) event planning and inducting by giving walkthrough of applicable policies and procedures.  6.  Collaboration:  Partner closely with hiring managers to understand their needs, provide insights on market trends, and facilitate the selection process to make informed hiring decisions. 7.  Compliance:  Ensure compliance with the internal hiring policy, as well as all the relevant laws and regulations governing recruitment and hiring processes. 8.  Reporting:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of recruitment activities, including candidate status, pipeline metrics, and hiring trends. Direct reporting will be to the Zonal Sales Director for the North 1 zone, with administrative reporting to the National Sales Human Resource Lead. 9.  Continuous Improvement:  Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the recruitment function. Preferred candidate profile     - 4-5 years of experience in talent acquisition, with a focus on hiring Sales professionals in the FMCG/OTC sector. - Willingness to travel within the designated region as needed. - Proven track record of successfully recruiting for similar roles in a fast-paced environment. - Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels. - Excellent communication and negotiation skills. Preferred Qualifications: - Experience working in the FMCG/OTC industry or a similar fast-paced consumer goods environment. - Knowledge of local market dynamics and talent trends in the North 1 zone (States mentioned in position overview) - Certification or training in recruitment and selection techniques. Perks and benefits

We are currently seeking a qualified  Technical Recruiter  to join our team. The Technical Recruiter will be responsible for creating and uploading job descriptions on various job boards, screening applicants, sourcing and hiring candidates for the organization, and maintaining the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). This role is ideal for someone with strong analytical and technical skills, attention to detail, and previous experience in a similar role in the engineering field. Location:  India Job Type:  Remote  Responsibilities Create and upload job postings on multiple job boards and the company website. Screen applicants, source, and hire candidates that meet the qualifications for various engineering positions within the organization. Build and maintain a pipeline of candidates for various technical positions. Research companies, websites, organizations, and engineering community groups that may have prospective candidates for sourcing. Maintain the Applicant Tracking System (ATS). Other duties as assigned. Basic Qualifications A Bachelors degree in Electronics, Computer, or Software engineering is preferred. A minimum of 2 years of recent experience recruiting in the engineering field. Prior work experience in the engineering field, such as Computer, Electronics, and/or Software Engineering is an asset. Proven experience with sourcing methods including Boolean search, networking, and job boards. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and various Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS). Strong analytical, problem-solving, and time management skills. Ability to work independently and within a team. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Please note: Interested applicants must apply directly to the employer to be considered for this position:  hr-india@aversan.com. The subject of the email should be  Technical Recruiter Application . The name of the file for the resume should be the applicants full name. The resume format should be PDF.

column2: Role & responsibilities     We are looking for an HR Executive (for Tamil Language) to manage our company recruiting, learning and development and employee performance programs.  Sat Kartar  have multiple centers, and each center is managed by respective HRs. So the main responsibility will be handling and managing the respective centers.   As an HR Executive, you will play a pivotal role in the human resources department, ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of various HR functions within the organization. Your responsibilities will encompass a broad spectrum of HR activities, ranging from recruitment and on boarding to employee relations and compliance.   Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with hiring managers to identify staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies. Source candidates through various channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks. Conduct interviews and assessments to evaluate candidate suitability for  assigned location . Coordinate and facilitate the onboarding process for new hires, including orientation and training. Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries, concerns, and grievances. Support the performance appraisal process, ensuring timely completion and documentation. Stay updated on relevant employment laws and regulations, ensuring company compliance. Conduct periodic audits to ensure adherence to HR policies and identify areas for improvement. Coordinate training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge. Maintain accurate employee records and HR databases. Assist with payroll processing and benefits administration as needed. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelors degree in Any Stream, or Business Administration, or a related field. Proven 2+ years of experience in an HR role, with a strong understanding of HR principles and practices. Tamil language will be preferred.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Work under pressure and great team player. Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Strong organisational skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office applications. Perks and benefits

column2: As a TA- Specialist at Naviga, you will play a pivotal role in attracting, sourcing, and selecting top-tier talent to join our organization. Working closely with hiring managers and HR team members, you will lead end-to-end recruitment processes, ensuring a seamless and efficient candidate experience. Your expertise in identifying qualified candidates, conducting interviews, and evaluating potential hires will contribute to the growth and success of our company.       Functional Duties/Responsibilities:         Lead the recruiting efforts for open positions including determining appropriate recruitment strategy based on labour demographics, drafting and posting advertisements and using case-by-case approaches to build candidate pool.     Ability to conduct market research for talent mapping in the target talent pool.      Maintains active relationships with proactive candidates who would be valuable employees      Performs searches for qualified candidates according to relevant job criteria, using various recruitment sources including social media, referrals, networking, direct sourcing from job portals.     Design recruitment strategy for addressing the recruitment needs as per business priorities.     Ability to deliver fast results for business critical positions by utilising best hiring approach.      Expert in Social Media hiring strategies and effectively utilizing various platforms for hiring.     Ability to lead the selection process including pre-screening resumes and candidates, participating as part of interview team as needed, advising managers on interview and selection techniques.     Organizes, leads and documents post-interview debrief/feedback with interview teams and candidates.     Acts as liaison between HR Management and the hiring manager on staffing issues      Frontend the new hire onboarding process for all hires and engage the offered candidate for smooth onboarding.     Participates in recruitment-related projects/initiatives such as vendor management, background screening, employer branding, enhancing referral selection or recommending change in existing processes, etc.      Travel as per business needs to stay connected with all personnel.         Education and Experience         Bachelor s Degree in a relevant discipline is preferred.     4-6 years of proven experience for the entire lifecycle IT recruitment across various levels and skills/technologies specific to technology space     Worked in fast paced growing organisation or startups.     Ability to multitask on various positions.     Strong organizational skills and attention to detail         Desired Behaviors         Receptive to change - is flexible. Seeks and adopts improved approaches and processes.      Initiates action - is results oriented, takes responsibility for actions and outcomes. Meets commitments and strives for high performance.      Manages the workload - makes timely decisions, prioritizes effectively, solves problems, monitors results and takes remedial action where necessary.      Technically proficient - knows role and has a solid familiarity with tasks and responsibilities.      Takes responsibility for own learning - knows personal strengths and recognizes development needs. Is open to feedback and always seek to learn.      Communicates ideas - strong facilitation and written communication, proposes a way forward. Listens to views of colleagues and takes in diverse perspectives.      Works collaboratively - shares information, fosters teamwork and contributes to positive work environment where people want to come to work.      Display ethical character and competence - acts with integrity and intent, is accountable for own actions, behaves per the values. Act as a good citizen of Naviga.
column11: Selection process, Networking, Talent acquisition, Staffing, Social media, Manager Technology, Market research, IT recruitment, Human resource management

column2: Manage full cycle recruiting process to ensure a smooth and positive experience for all candidates- including recruitment strategy session (intake meeting), candidate sourcing, interviewing, selection processes, offer management, process documentation, compliance management, and status communication with candidates and hiring managers.     Throughout the process guide and train Hiring Manager capability and shared ownership for recruiting      Provide weekly status updates and Inputs for the global recruitment report on the progress of assigned requisitions and projects.      Mindful manage and improve on key metrics such as time to fill, while keeping external recruitment cost within or below budget     Partner with Regional HR team to review, analyse and make recommendations for candidate offers and negotiations.      Drive process simplification, ensure recruiting process remains complete, nimble, and creates the right experience for candidates, hiring managers, HR and recruiters globally.     Utilize industry knowledge to provide input on finding functional talent (best sourcing/recruiting channels and methods), which includes utilizing labor market consultation, competitive intelligence, and selling the Naviga brand.      Leverages subject matter expertise to partner with business and HR leadership regarding recruiting/sourcing strategies, candidate behavioral and job assessments, metrics and analytics, position responsibilities, headcount approvals and forecasting, etc.      Manages respective candidate pools to ensure qualified candidates remain engaged in current or future opportunities and ensure a strong and positive client and candidate experience.      Provides general training and direction related to a Talent Recruitment process or system for HR professionals in the business.      Where applicable, participates in the management and selection of vendors.     Drawing upon general employment knowledge and experience, ensure compliance requirements are met which may include: Policy and legal requirements for a specific region/country/state, Administration of internal systems and processes to ensure compliance with country/local labor laws, coordinate accountability measures and processes to ensure compliance of policies, processes, and procedures in alignment with Global programs.      Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict confidentiality in matters that require discretion          EXPERIENCE         Bachelor s degree     8+ year corporate recruiting experience in a high-tech / high-volume environment.      Engage business leaders in partnership with Regional HR to understand the business direction and staffing strategy - influence thinking on staffing, and leverage understanding to inform yearly/multi-yr talent pipelining      Develop effective relationships with HR team and hiring managers for assigned region.      Develop proactive creative sourcing strategies to attract top talent and create pipelines for critical skill areas     Leverage and utilise social media platforms to attract and engage talent.      Lead selection processes that ensure equal employment opportunities exist for all internal and external candidates.      Guide managers and provide feedback before, during and after the process to ensure objective and mindful practices are being followed.      Gathering feedback for internal candidates, partnering with Regional HR team to manage internal candidates with respect and dignity.          KNOWLEDGE          LinkedIn and local job boards- Sourcing and effective candidate communications that excite candidates to engage with Naviga.      Facilitation of trainings and/or public speaking     Business savvy with the ability to discuss business matters and organizational requirements.      Globally aligned in process, strategy, and guidance to managers.      Ability to strategically align business needs, team dynamics and job requirements to source top talent.      Great with people. Everyone can count on you to get the job done...always!          DESIRED BEHAVIORS          Receptive to change - is flexible. Seeks and adopts improved approaches and processes.      Initiates action - is results oriented, takes responsibility for actions and outcomes. Meets commitments and strives for high performance.      Manages the workload - makes timely decisions, prioritizes effectively, solves problems, monitors results and takes remedial action where necessary.     Technically proficient - knows role and has a solid familiarity with tasks and responsibilities.      Takes responsibility for own learning - knows personal strengths and recognizes development needs. Is open to feedback and always seek to learn.      Communicates ideas - strong facilitation and written communication, proposes a way forward. Listens to views of colleagues and takes in diverse perspectives.     Works collaboratively - shares information, fosters teamwork and contributes to positive work environment where people want to come to work. Job Brief:        We are looking for a Corporate Recruiter to be responsible for the full spectrum of the hiring plan from identifying needs and shortlisting candidates to closing successful hires.      Corporate Recruiter responsibilities include creating and publishing job ads, interviewing candidates and seeking out new candidate sources. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with full-cycle recruitment and great communication skills.      Ultimately, you will maintain and improve our employer brand, ensuring that we attract, hire and retain people      who contribute to our company s growth.        Responsibilities:        Work closely with hiring managers in various departments to define recruitment needs and plan the hiring process      Set hiring goals (e.g. quarterly and annual)      Track recruitment KPIs, like time to hire, source of hire and time to fill      Manage all communication with candidates from the moment they apply until they get onboard      Source candidates on job boards, resume databases, professional networks and through referrals      Interview candidates at various stages of the hiring process (phone screening calls, video interviews and in-person meetings)      Use skill assessment tools and tests to screen candidates      Oversee internal and external communication, making sure that our company maintains a positive reputation as an employer (for example on Glassdoor, LinkedIn and social media)      Organize hiring events and participate in job fairs to network with potential candidates            Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications    Experience:    Internal hiring: 3 months-1 Year    Calling: 3 months-1 Year    Resume Sourcing from LinkedIn, Indeed and other job boards/tools: 3 months-1 Year      Required Skills:        Work experience as an In-house Recruiter      Familiarity with full cycle recruitment      Hands-on experience with recruitment software and Applicant Tracking Systems      Strong interviewing skills and familiarity with various interview techniques (like video or panel interviews)      Experience with social media recruiting      Understanding of HR practices and labor legislation      Exceptional communication skills      Bachelor in Human      Resources Management or relevant degree        Education:    Bachelor s (Required)      Benefits:    Lucrative Rewards Recognition    Incentive    Employee friendly Corporate Work culture    Timings are fixed with Sunday Off

This includes learning how to source candidates on job portals and LinkedIn, both for passive and active hiring. Additionally, they will be taught how to conduct telephonic interviews with candidates before forwarding their resumes to the hiring manager, as well as how to prepare a tracker to keep records.  After the training, interns will be assigned live projects to source relevant candidates. The duration of the internship will be three months. Upon successful completion of the internship, interns can apply for entry-level positions as Recruitment and Talent Acquisition Specialists in reputable companies.
column11: Good English Communication
